Ge Ex Le Nu De Jos Jg Ru 1Sa 2Sa 1Ki 2Ki 1Ch 2Ch Ezr Ne Es Job Ps Pr Ec Son Isa Jer La Eze Da Ho Joe Am Ob Jon Mic Na Hab Zep Hag Zec Mal Mt Mr Lu Joh Ac Ro 1Co 2Co Ga Eph Php Col 1Th 2Th 1Ti 2Ti Tit Phm Heb Jas 1Pe 2Pe 1Jo 2Jo 3Jo Jud Re
Low Normal High

Song of Solomon

SummaryThe book of Song of Solomon is a large love poem filled with smaller poems of different kinds. Solomon is the author and he wrote it sometime during his reign 970-930 B.C. It is a story of a bridegroom who is in love with his bride. Key personalities are King Solomon, the Shulammite girl, and friends.The story greatly emphasizes the sanctity of marriage and that it is designed, blessed and consecrated in the eyes of the Lord. The purpose of “Song of Songs”, as it is also called, is a picture of God’s love for His people. Although there is explicit sexual content, it is a book in which we can learn the depths of God’s authentic love for us and what should be in the sacredness of marriage.

•    In chapters 1-3, Solomon writes of the courtship and engagement of the Beloved (Solomon) and the Lover (Shulammite girl), “My beloved responded and said to me, ‘Arise, my darling, my beautiful one, and come along” (2:10).

•    Chapters 3-4, we read of the marriage ceremony of the bride to the bridegroom, “Go forth, O daughters of Zion, and gaze on King Solomon with the crown with which his mother has crowned him on the day of his wedding” (3:11).

•    Chapters 5-8, are the relationship between the husband and wife and the power of their love, “Many waters cannot quench love, nor will rivers overflow it; if a man were to give all the riches of his house for love, it would be utterly despised” (8:7).
    Outline
  2. 1. The Courtship  ( 1:1⁠–⁠3:5 )
  3. a. The Bride Confesses Her Love  ( 1:1⁠–⁠17 )
  4. b. The Bride’s Admiration  ( 2:1⁠–⁠17 )
  5. c. The Bride’s Dream  ( 3:1⁠–⁠5 )
  6. 2. The Wedding  ( 3:6⁠–⁠4:16 )
  7. a. Solomon Arrives on His Wedding Day  ( 3:6⁠–⁠11 )
  8. b. Solomon Admires His Bride  ( 4:1⁠–⁠16 )
  9. 3. The Marriage  ( 5:1⁠–⁠8:14 )
  10. a. The Bride and Her Beloved  ( 5:1⁠–⁠16 )
  11. b. Together in the Garden  ( 6:1⁠–⁠13 )
  12. c. Admiration by the Bridegroom  ( 7:1⁠–⁠13 )
  13. d. Longing for Her Beloved  ( 8:1⁠–⁠14 )

1

"Solomon's"

Translation

Lit: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth for is better your love than wine

KJV: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.

"him"

3 Because of the savour of your good ointments your name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love you.Song of Solomon 1:3
Stats
Rank: #4706 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 117 characters, 20 words, 95 letters, 38 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לְרֵ֙יחַ֙ שְׁמָנֶ֣יךָ טֹובִ֔ים שֶׁ֖מֶן תּוּרַ֣ק שְׁמֶ֑ךָ עַל־כֵּ֖ן עֲלָמֹ֥ות אֲהֵבֽוּךָ׃

Lit: Because of the fragrance of your ointments good ointment poured forth Your name is upon thus the virgins love you

KJV: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.
References

"the savour"

Ps 133:2: It is like the precious ointment upon the head: that ran down upon the beard: even Aaron's beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;
Pr 27:9: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so does the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.
Ec 7:1: A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one's birth.
Isa 61:3: To appoint to them that mourn in Zion: to give to them beauty for ashes: the oil of joy for mourning: the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness: the planting of the LORD: that He might be glorified.
Joh 12:3: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard: very costly: and anointed the feet of Jesus: and wiped His feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.
2Co 2:14-16: Now thanks be to God: which always causes us to triumph in Christ: and makes manifest the savour of His knowledge by us in every place.
Php 4:18: But I have all: and abound: I am full: having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you: an odour of a sweet smell: a sacrifice acceptable: wellpleasing to God.

"thy name"

"the virgins"

2Co 11:2: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband: that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
Re 14:4: These are they which not were defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb wherever He goes. These were redeemed from among men: being the firstfruits to God and to the Lamb.

4 Draw me, we will run after you: the king has brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in you, we will remember your love more than wine: the upright love you.Song of Solomon 1:4
Stats
Rank: #4890 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 178 characters, 30 words, 138 letters, 51 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מָשְׁכֵ֖נִי אַחֲרֶ֣יךָ נָּר֑וּצָה הֱבִיאַ֨נִי הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ חֲדָרָ֗יו נָגִ֤ילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָה֙ בָּ֔ךְ נַזְכִּ֤ירָה דֹדֶ֙יךָ֙ מִיַּ֔יִן מֵישָׁרִ֖ים אֲהֵבֽוּךָ׃ ס

Lit: Draw me away after you we will run has brought me the king into his chambers We will be glad and rejoice in you we will remember your love more than wine Rightly do they love you

KJV: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
References

"Draw"
Jer 31:3: The LORD has appeared of old to me: saying: Yes: I have loved you with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn you.
Ho 11:4: I drew them with cords of a man: with bands of love: and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws: and I laid meat to them.
Joh 6:44: No man can come to me: except the Father which has sent me draw Him: and I will raise Him up at the last day.
Joh 12:32: I: if I be lifted up from the earth: will draw all men to me.
Php 2:12: 13: For what reason: my beloved: as you have always obeyed: not as in my presence only: but now much more in my absence: work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

"we will"
Ps 119:32: 60: I will run the way of your commandments: when you will enlarge my heart.
Heb 12:1: For what reason seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses: let us lay aside every weight: and the sin which does so easily beset us: and let us run with patience the race that is set before us:

"the king"
Song 2:3-5: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood: so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight: and his fruit was sweet to my taste.
Song 3:4: It was but a little that I passed from them: but I found him whom my soul loves: I held him: and not would let him go: until I had brought him into my mother's house: and into the chamber of her that conceived me.
Ps 45:14: 15: She will be brought to the king in clothing of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her will be brought to you.
Mt 25:10: While they went to buy: the groom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage: and the door was shut.
Joh 14:2: 3: In my Father's house are many mansions: if it were not so: I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
Eph 2:6: has raised us up together: and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:

"we will be"
Ps 98:4-9: Make a joyful noise to the LORD: all the earth: make a loud noise: and rejoice: and sing praise.
Ps 149:2: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
Isa 25:8: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of His people will He take away from off all the earth: for the LORD has spoken it.
Isa 45:25: In the LORD will all the seed of Israel be justified: and will glory.

Lu 2:10: The angel said to them: not Fear: for: look: I bring you good tidings of great joy: which will be to all people.
Php 3:3: For we are the circumcision: which worship God in the spirit: and rejoice in Christ Jesus: and have no confidence in the flesh.
Php 4:4: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say: Rejoice.
1Pe 1:8: Whom not having seen: you love; in whom: though now you see him not: yet believing: you rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

"remember"
Song 1:2: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for your love is better than wine.
Ps 42:4: When I remember these things: I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude: I went with them to the house of God: with the voice of joy and praise: with a multitude that kept holyday.
Ps 48:9: We have thought of your lovingkindness: O God: in the middle of your temple.
Ps 63:5: My soul will be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth will praise you with joyful lips:
Ps 103:1: 2: A Psalm of David.>> Bless the LORD: O my soul: and all that is within me: bless His holy name.
Ps 111:4: He has made His wonderful works to be remembered: the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.
Isa 63:7: I will mention the lovingkindnesses of the LORD: and the praises of the LORD: according to all that the LORD has bestowed on us: and the great goodness toward the house of Israel: which He has bestowed on them according to His mercies: and according to the multitude of His lovingkindnesses.
Lu 22:19: He took bread: and gave thanks: and brake it: and gave to them: saying: This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.
1Co 11:23-26: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered to you: That the Lord Jesus the same night in which He was betrayed took bread:

"the upright love thee"
Song 1:3: Because of the savour of your good ointments your name is as ointment poured forth: therefore do the virgins love you.
Joh 21:15-17: So when they had dined: Jesus says to Simon Peter: Simon: son of Jonas: love you me more than these? He says to Him: Yes: Lord; you know that I love you. He says to Him: Feed my lambs.
Eph 6:24: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen. Written from Rome to the Ephesians by Tychicus.>>

5 I am black, but comely, O you daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.Song of Solomon 1:5
Stats
Rank: #5108 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 103 characters, 16 words, 79 letters, 31 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שְׁחֹורָ֤ה אֲנִי֙ וְֽנָאוָ֔ה בְּנֹ֖ות יְרוּשָׁלִָ֑ם כְּאָהֳלֵ֣י קֵדָ֔ר כִּירִיעֹ֖ות שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃

Lit: am dark I but lovely daughters of Jerusalem Like the tents of Kedar Like the curtains of Solomon

KJV: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.
References

"black"
Isa 53:2: For he will grow up before him as a tender plant: and as a root out of a dry ground: he has no form nor comeliness; and when we will see him: there is no beauty that we should desire him.
Mt 10:25: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master: and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub: how much more will they call them of his household?
1Co 4:10-13: We are fools for Christ's sake: but you are wise in Christ; we are weak: but you are strong; you are honourable: but we are despised.
1Jo 3:1: Look: what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us: that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knows not us: because it knew Him not">not Him.

"comely"

Ps 149:4: For the LORD takes pleasure in His people: He will beautify the meek with salvation.
Isa 61:10: I will greatly rejoice in the LORD: my soul will be joyful in my God; for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation: He has covered me with the robe of righteousness: as a groom decks Himself with ornaments: and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.
Eze 16:14: your renown went forth among the heathen for your beauty: for it was perfect through my comeliness: which I had put upon you: says the Lord GOD.
Mt 22:11: When the king came in to see the guests: he saw there a man which not had on a wedding garment:
Lu 15:22: But the father said to his servants: Bring forth the best robe: and put it on him; and put a ring on his hand: and shoes on his feet:
Ro 13:14: But put you on the Lord Jesus Christ: and not make provision for the flesh: to fulfil the lusts thereof.
2Co 5:21: For He has made Him to be sin for us: who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in Him.
Eph 5:26: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word:

"O ye"

Ga 4:26: But Jerusalem which is above is free: which is the mother of us all.

"as the tents"

6 not Look upon me, because I am black, because the sun has looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but my own vineyard have not I kept.Song of Solomon 1:6
Stats
Rank: #5796 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 198 characters, 32 words, 152 letters, 60 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תִּרְא֙וּנִי֙ שֶׁאֲנִ֣י שְׁחַרְחֹ֔רֶת שֶׁשֱּׁזָפַ֖תְנִי הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ בְּנֵ֧י אִמִּ֣י נִֽחֲרוּ־בִ֗י שָׂמֻ֙נִי֙ נֹטֵרָ֣ה אֶת־הַכְּרָמִ֔ים כַּרְמִ֥י שֶׁלִּ֖י לֹ֥א נָטָֽרְתִּי׃

Lit: Not do look upon me because I am dark because has tanned me the sun sons of My mother were angry with me they made me the keeper of the vineyards vineyard my own not But I have kept

KJV: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; [but] mine own vineyard have I not kept.

"Look"

"because"

Jer 8:21: For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt; I am black; astonishment has taken hold on me.
La 4:8: Their visage is blacker than a coal; they not are known in the streets: their skin cleaves to their bones; it is withered: it is become like a stick.
Mr 4:6: But when the sun was up: it was scorched; and because it had no root: it withered away.
Ac 14:22: Confirming the souls of the disciples: and exhorting them to continue in the faith: and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.

"my mother's"
Ps 69:8: I am become a stranger to my brothers: and an alien to my mother's children.

Mic 7:6: For the son dishonours the father: the daughter rises up against her mother: the daughter in law against her mother in law; a man's enemies are the men of his own house.

Ga 4:29: But as then He that'>He who was born after the flesh persecuted Him that was born after the Spirit: even so it is now.

"keeper"

7 Tell me, O you whom my soul loves, where you feed, where you make your flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turns aside by the flocks of your companions?Song of Solomon 1:7
Stats
Rank: #6170 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 180 characters, 32 words, 140 letters, 50 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַגִּ֣ידָה לִּ֗י שֶׁ֤אָהֲבָה֙ נַפְשִׁ֔י אֵיכָ֣ה תִרְעֶ֔ה אֵיכָ֖ה תַּרְבִּ֣יץ בַּֽצָּהֳרָ֑יִם שַׁלָּמָ֤ה אֶֽהְיֶה֙ כְּעֹ֣טְיָ֔ה עַ֖ל עֶדְרֵ֥י חֲבֵרֶֽיךָ׃

Lit: Tell you me whom love I where you feed your flock where you make it rest at noon for why should I be as one who veils herself by the flocks of your companions

KJV: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

Mt 10:37: He who loves'>loves father or mother more than me not is worthy of me: and he who loves'>loves son or daughter more than me not is worthy of me.

"turneth aside"
Col 3:14-18: Above all these things put on charity: which is the bond of perfectness.

Counts: 82 characters, 13 words, 67 letters, 21 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation

Lit: While the king is at his table My spikenard sends forth its fragrance

KJV: While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
References

"the king"

Ps 45:1: > My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
Mt 22:11: When the king came in to see the guests: he saw there a man which not had on a wedding garment:

"sitteth"

Mt 22:4: Again: he sent forth other servants: saying: Tell them which are bidden: Look: I have prepared my dinner: my oxen and my fatlings are killed: and all things are ready: come to the marriage.
Mt 26:26-28: As they were eating: Jesus took bread: and blessed it: and brake it: and gave it to the disciples: and said: Take: eat; this is my body.
Lu 24:30-32: It came to pass: as he sat at meat with them: he took bread: and blessed it: and brake: and gave to them.
Re 3:20: Look: I stand at the door: and knock: if any man hear my voice: and open the door: I will come in to him: and will sup with him: and he with me.

"my"

Joh 12:3: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard: very costly: and anointed the feet of Jesus: and wiped His feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.
Php 4:18: But I have all: and abound: I am full: having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you: an odour of a sweet smell: a sacrifice acceptable: wellpleasing to God.
Re 8:3: 4: Another angel came and stood at the altar: having a golden censer; and there was given to him much incense: that he should offer it with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.

H1266בְּרוֹתִֽים׃bə-rō-w-ṯîm.   (N-mp)

17 The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.Song of Solomon 1:17
Stats
Rank: #6855 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 59 characters, 10 words, 44 letters, 20 vowels, 24 consonants
Translation

Lit: The beams of our houses are cedar And our rafters of fir

KJV: The beams of our house are cedar, [and] our rafters of fir.
References

"beams"
Song 8:9: If she be a wall: we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door: we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
2Ch 2:8: 9: Send me also cedar trees: fir trees: and algum trees: out of Lebanon: for I know that your servants can skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and: look: my servants will be with your servants:
Ps 92:12: The righteous will flourish like the palm tree: he will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
1Ti 3:15: 16: But if I tarry long: that you may know how you ought to behave yourself in the house of God: which is the church of the living God: the pillar and ground of the truth.
Heb 11:10: For He looked for a city which has foundations: whose builder and maker is God.
1Pe 2:4: 5: To whom coming: as to a living stone: disallowed indeed of men: but chosen of God: and precious:

"rafters"
Song 7:5: Your head upon you is like Carmel: and the hair of your head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.
Eze 41:16: The door posts: and the narrow windows: and the galleries round about on their 3 stories: over against the door: cieled with wood round about: and from the ground up to the windows: and the windows were covered;
Eze 42:3: Over against the 20 cubits which were for the inner court: and over against the pavement which was for the utter court: was gallery against gallery in 3 stories.

אֲנִי֙ חֲבַצֶּ֣לֶת הַשָּׁרֹ֔ון שֹֽׁושַׁנַּ֖ת הָעֲמָקִֽים׃

H589אֲנִי֙’ă-nî   (Pro-1cs)
H589 אֲנִי ʼănîy an-ee lemma אֲנַי second vowel, corrected to אֲנִי; contracted from אָנֹכִי; I; I, (as for) me, mine, myself, we, idiom which, idiom who., 		אֲנִי֙’ă-nî I Pro-1cs

H8289הַשָּׁר֔וֹןhaš-šā-rō-wn,   (Art | N-proper-fs)

H7799שֽׁוֹשַׁנַּ֖תšō-wō-šan-naṯ   (N-csc)
H7799 שׁוּשַׁן shûwshan shoo-shan or שׁוֹשָׁן; or שֹׁשָׁן; and (feminine) שׁוֹשַׁנָּה; from שׂוּשׂ; a lily (from its whiteness), as aflower of architectural ornament; also a (straight) trumpet (from the tubular shape); lily, Shoshannim. 		שֽׁוֹשַׁנַּ֖תšō-wō-šan-naṯ And the lily N-csc

Stats

Lit: I am the rose of Sharon And the lily of the valleys

KJV: I am the rose of Sharon, [and] the lily of the valleys.
References

"the rose"

"lily"

Song 6:3: I am my beloved's: and my beloved is my: he feeds among the lilies.
Isa 57:15: For thus says the high and lofty one that inhabits eternity: whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place: with Him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit: to revive the spirit of the humble: and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.

H996בֵּ֣יןbên   (Prep)
H996 בֵּין bêyn bane (sometimes in the plural masculine or feminine); properly, the constructive form of an otherwise unused noun from בִּין; a distinction; but used only as a preposition,; between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or; among, asunder, at, between (-twixt...and), phrase from (the widest), idiom in, out of, whether (it be...or), within. 		בֵּ֣יןbên among Prep

H3651 כֵּן kên kane from כּוּן; properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles); phrase after that (this, -ward, -wards), as... as, phrase (for-) asmuch as yet, phrase be (for which) cause, phrase following, howbeit, in (the) like (manner, -wise), idiom the more, right, (even) so, state, straightway, such (thing), surely, phrase there (where) -fore, this, thus, true, well, idiom you., 		כֵּ֥ןkên so Adv

3 As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.Song of Solomon 2:3
Stats
Rank: #1957 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 166 characters, 29 words, 127 letters, 47 vowels, 80 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּתַפּ֙וּחַ֙ בַּעֲצֵ֣י הַיַּ֔עַר כֵּ֥ן דֹּודִ֖י בֵּ֣ין הַבָּנִ֑ים בְּצִלֹּו֙ חִמַּ֣דְתִּי וְיָשַׁ֔בְתִּי וּפִרְיֹ֖ו מָתֹ֥וק לְחִכִּֽי׃

Lit: Like an apple tree among the trees of the woods so is my beloved among the sons In his shade with great delight and I sat down and his fruit was sweet to my taste

KJV: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit [was] sweet to my taste.
References

"the apple tree"
Song 8:5: Who is this that comes up from the wilderness: leaning upon her beloved? I raised you up under the apple tree: there your mother brought you forth: there she brought you forth that bare you.
Isa 4:2: In that day will the branch of the LORD be beautiful and glorious: and the fruit of the earth will be excellent and comely for them that are escaped of Israel.
Eze 17:23: 24: In the mountain of the height of Israel will I plant it: and it will bring forth boughs: and bear fruit: and be a goodly cedar: and under it will dwell all fowl of every wing; in the shadow of the branches thereof will they dwell.
Joh 15:1-8: I am the true vine: and my Father is the husbandman.

"my beloved"
Song 5:9: 10: 16: What is your beloved more than another beloved: O you fair among women? what is your beloved more than another beloved: that you do so charge us?
Ps 45:2: You are fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into your lips: therefore God has blessed you for ever.
Ps 89:6: For who in the heaven can be compared to the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened to the LORD?
Joh 1:14-18: The Word was made flesh: and dwelt among us: (and we beheld His glory: the glory as of the only begotten of the Father: ) full of grace and truth.
Joh 3:29-31: He who has the bride is the groom: but the friend of the groom: which stands and hears him: rejoices greatly because of the groom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
Heb 1:1-6: God: who at sundry times and in divers manners spoke in time past to the fathers by the prophets:
Heb 3:1-6: For what reason: holy brothers: partakers of the heavenly calling: consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession: Christ Jesus;
Heb 7:23-26: They truly were many priests: because they not were suffered to continue by reason of death:
Heb 12:2: Looking to Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross: despising the shame: and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.

"I sat, etc"

Ps 57:1: He fled from Saul in the cave.>> Be merciful to me: O God: be merciful to me: for my soul trusts in you: yes: in the shadow of your wings will I make my refuge: until these calamities be overpast.
Ps 91:1: He who dwells in the secret place of the most High will abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

Isa 25:4: For you have been a strength to the poor: a strength to the needy in his distress: a refuge from the storm: a shadow from the heat: when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.
Isa 32:2: A man will be as an hiding place from the wind: and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place: as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
1Jo 1:3: 4: That which we have seen and heard declare we to you: that you also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father: and with His Son Jesus Christ.

"his fruit"
Song 2:5: Stay me with flagons: comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.
Ge 3:22-24: The LORD God said: Look: the man is become as one of us: to know good and evil: and now: lest He put forth His hand: and take also of the tree of life: and eat: and live for ever:
Eze 47:12: By the river upon the bank thereof: on this side and on that side: will grow all trees for meat: whose leaf will not fade: neither will the fruit thereof be consumed: it will bring forth new fruit according to his months: because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof will be for meat: and the leaf thereof for medicine.
Re 22:1: 2: He showed me a pure river of water of life: clear as crystal: proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

H413אֶל־’el-   (Prep)
H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		אֶל־’el- to Prep

4 He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.Song of Solomon 2:4
Stats
Rank: #4093 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 71 characters, 13 words, 56 letters, 23 vowels, 33 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֱבִיאַ֙נִי֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַיָּ֔יִן וְדִגְלֹ֥ו עָלַ֖י אַהֲבָֽה׃

Lit: He brought me to house the banqueting and his banner over me was love

KJV: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.
References

"brought"
Song 1:4: Draw me: we will run after you: the king has brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in you: we will remember your love more than wine: the upright love you.
Song 5:1: I am come into my garden: my sister: my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat: O friends; drink: yes: drink abundantly: O beloved.
Ps 63:2-5: To see your power and your glory: so as I have seen you in the sanctuary.
Ps 84:10: For a day in your courts is better than a000. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God: than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
Joh 14:21-23: He who has my commandments: and keeps them: He it is that loves'>loves me: and He that'>He who loves'>loves me will be loved of my Father: and I will love Him: and will manifest myself to Him.
Re 3:20: Look: I stand at the door: and knock: if any man hear my voice: and open the door: I will come in to him: and will sup with him: and he with me.

"banqueting house"
Song 1:1: 4: The song of songs: which is Solomon's.
Es 7:7: The king arising from the banquet of wine in his wrath went into the palace garden: and Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.

"his banner"
Song 6:4: You are beautiful: O my love: as Tirzah: comely as Jerusalem: terrible as an army with banners.
Job 1:10: Have not you made an hedge about him: and about his house: and about all that he has on every side? you have blessed the work of his hands: and his substance is increased in the land.
Ps 60:4: You have given a banner to them that fear you: that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
Isa 11:10: In that day there will be a root of Jesse: which will stand for an ensign of the people; to it will the Gentiles seek: and his rest will be glorious.
Joh 15:9-15: As the Father has loved me: so have I loved you: continue you in my love.
Ro 5:8-10: But God commends His love toward us: in that: while we were yet sinners: Christ died for us.
Ro 8:28-39: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God: to them who are the called according to His purpose.

H3588כִּי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּי־kî- for Conj
H2470חוֹלַ֥תḥō-w-laṯ   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-fsc)
H2470 חָלָה châlâh khaw-law a primitive root (compare חוּל, חָלָה, חָלַל); properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat; beseech, (be) diseased, (put to) grief, be grieved, (be) grievous, infirmity, intreat, lay to, put to pain, idiom pray, make prayer, be (fall, make) sick, sore, be sorry, make suit (idiom supplication), woman in travail, be (become) weak, be wounded. 		חוֹלַ֥תḥō-w-laṯ sick V-Qal-Prtcpl-fsc

"flagons"

H2654שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃šet-teḥ-pāṣ.   (Verb)
H2654 חָפֵץ châphêts khaw-fates a primitive root; properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire; idiom any at all, (have, take) delight, desire, favour, like, move, be (well) pleased, have pleasure, will, would. 		שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃šet-teḥ-pāṣ. until he please Verb
7 I charge you, O you daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that you not stir up, nor awake my love, till he please.Song of Solomon 2:7
Stats
Rank: #7811 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 142 characters, 24 words, 106 letters, 41 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֨עְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֜ם בְּנֹ֤ות יְרוּשָׁלִַ֙ם֙ בִּצְבָאֹ֔ות אֹ֖ו בְּאַיְלֹ֣ות הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה אִם־תָּעִ֧ירוּ ׀ וְֽאִם־תְּעֹֽורְר֛וּ אֶת־הָאַהֲבָ֖ה עַ֥ד שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃ ס

Lit: I charge you daughters of Jerusalem by the gazelles or by the does of the field not do stir up nor awaken love Until it pleases until he please

KJV: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
References

"charge you"
Mt 26:63: But Jesus held His peace. And the high priest answered and said to Him: I adjure you by the living God: that you tell us whether you be the Christ: the Son of God.

"O ye"
Song 1:5: I am black: but comely: O you daughters of Jerusalem: as the tents of Kedar: as the curtains of Solomon.
Song 5:8: 16: I charge you: O daughters of Jerusalem: if you find my beloved: that you tell him: that I am sick of love.

"by the roes"
Song 3:5: I charge you: O you daughters of Jerusalem: by the roes: and by the hinds of the field: that you not stir up: nor awake my love: till he please.
Pr 5:19: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy you at all times; and be you ravished always with her love.

"ye stir"
Song 8:4: I charge you: O daughters of Jerusalem: that you not stir up: nor awake my love: until he please.
Eph 5:22-33: Wives: submit yourselves to your own husbands: as to the Lord.

Translation

Lit: The voice of my beloved behold this one comes Leaping upon the mountains Skipping upon the hills

KJV: The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
References

"voice"

Joh 3:29: He who has the bride is the groom: but the friend of the groom: which stands and hears him: rejoices greatly because of the groom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
Joh 10:4: 5: 27: When he puts forth his own sheep: he goes before them: and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.
Re 3:20: Look: I stand at the door: and knock: if any man hear my voice: and open the door: I will come in to him: and will sup with him: and he with me.

"leaping"

Isa 35:6: Then will the lame man leap as an hart: and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness will waters break out: and streams in the desert.
Jer 48:27: For not was Israel a derision to you? was he found among thieves? for since you spake of him: you skippedst for joy.
Lu 6:23: Rejoice you in that day: and leap for joy: for: look: your reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers to the prophets.
Ac 3:8: He leaping up stood: and walked: and entered with them into the temple: walking: and leaping: and praising God.
Ac 14:10: Said with a loud voice: Stand upright on your feet. And he leaped and walked.

"the mountains"

9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: look, he stands behind our wall, he looks forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.Song of Solomon 2:9
Stats
Rank: #6948 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 148 characters, 23 words, 117 letters, 43 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דֹּומֶ֤ה דֹודִי֙ לִצְבִ֔י אֹ֖ו לְעֹ֣פֶר הָֽאַיָּלִ֑ים הִנֵּה־זֶ֤ה עֹומֵד֙ אַחַ֣ר כָּתְלֵ֔נוּ מַשְׁגִּ֙יחַ֙ מִן־הַֽחֲלֹּנֹ֔ות מֵצִ֖יץ מִן־הַֽחֲרַכִּֽים׃

Lit: Is like My beloved a gazelle or young a stag Behold this one stands behind our wall He is looking through the windows Gazing through the lattice

KJV: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.
References

"like"
Song 2:17: Until the day break: and the shadows flee away: turn: my beloved: and be you like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
Song 8:14: Make haste: my beloved: and be you like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.

"he standeth"
1Co 13:12: For now we see through a glass: darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then will I know even as also I am known.
2Co 3:13-18: not And as Moses: which put a vail over his face: that the children of Israel not could stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:
Eph 2:14: 15: For he is our peace: who has made both one: and has broken down the middle wall of partition between us;
Col 2:17: Which are a shadow of things to come; but the body is of Christ.
Heb 9:8: 9: The Holy Ghost this signifying: that the way into the holy of all not was yet made manifest: while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:
Heb 10:1: 19: 20: For the law having a shadow of good things to come: and not the very image of the things: can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

"shewing"
Lu 24:35: They told what things were done in the way: and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.
Joh 5:39: 46: Search the scriptures; for in them you think you have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.
Joh 12:41: These things said Isaiah: when he saw his glory: and spoke of him.
1Pe 1:10-12: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and searched diligently: who prophesied of the grace that should come to you:
Re 19:10: I fell at His feet to worship Him. And He said to me: See you do it not: I am your fellowservant: and of your brothers that have the testimony of Jesus: worship God: for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

H6030עָנָ֥ה‘ā-nāh   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms)
H6030 עָנָה ʻânâh aw-naw a primitive root; properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce; give account, afflict (by mistake for עָנָה), (cause to, give) answer, bring low (by mistake for עָנָה), cry, hear, Leannoth, lift up, say, idiom scholar, (give a) shout, sing (together by course), speak, testify, utter, (bear) witness. 10 My beloved spoke, and said to me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.Song of Solomon 2:10
Stats
Rank: #6947 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 81 characters, 12 words, 59 letters, 25 vowels, 34 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עָנָ֥ה דֹודִ֖י וְאָ֣מַר לִ֑י ק֥וּמִי לָ֛ךְ רַעְיָתִ֥י יָפָתִ֖י וּלְכִי־לָֽךְ׃

Lit: Spoke My beloved and said to me Rise up to me my love my fair one and come away to

KJV: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
References

"spake"
Song 2:8: The voice of my beloved! look: he comes leaping upon the mountains: skipping upon the hills.
2Sa 23:3: The God of Israel said: the Rock of Israel spoke to me: He who rules over men must be just: ruling in the fear of God.
Ps 85:8: I will hear what God the LORD will speak: for He will speak peace to His people: and to His saints: but let not them turn again to folly.
Jer 31:3: The LORD has appeared of old to me: saying: Yes: I have loved you with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn you.

"Rise"
Song 2:13: The fig tree puts forth her green figs: and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise: my love: my fair one: and come away.
Song 4:7: 8: You are all fair: my love; there is no spot in you.
Song 5:2: I sleep: but my heart wakes: it is the voice of my beloved that knocks: saying: Open to me: my sister: my love: my dove: my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew: and my locks with the drops of the night.
Ge 12:1-3: Now the LORD had said to Abram: Get you out of your country: and from your kindred: and from your father's house: to a land that I will show you:
Ps 45:10: 11: Listen: O daughter: and consider: and incline your ear; forget also your own people: and your father's house;
Mt 4:19-22: He says to them: Follow me: and I will make you fishers of men.
Mt 9:9: As Jesus passed forth from there: He saw a man: named Matthew: sitting at the receipt of custom: and He says to Him: Follow me. And He arose: and followed Him.
2Co 6:17: 18: For what reason come out from among them: and be you separate: says the Lord: and not touch the unclean thing; and I will receive you:
2Co 11:2: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband: that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.

Re 22:17: The Spirit and the bride say: Come. And let Him that hears say: Come. And let Him that is athirst come. And whoever will: let Him take the water of life freely.

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- For Conj

Translation

13 The fig tree puts forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.Song of Solomon 2:13
Stats
Rank: #6804 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 143 characters, 21 words, 108 letters, 41 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַתְּאֵנָה֙ חָֽנְטָ֣ה פַגֶּ֔יהָ וְהַגְּפָנִ֥ים ׀ סְמָדַ֖ר נָ֣תְנוּ רֵ֑יחַ ק֥וּמִי [לְכִי כ] (לָ֛ךְ ק) רַעְיָתִ֥י יָפָתִ֖י וּלְכִי־לָֽךְ׃ ס

Lit: the fig tree puts forth her green figs and the vines with the tender grapes Give a good smell Arise Rise up My love my fair one and come away to

KJV: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a [good] smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
References

"fig-tree"
Song 6:11: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley: and to see whether the vine flourished: and the pomegranates budded.
Song 7:8: 11-13: I said: I will go up to the palm tree: I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also your breasts will be as clusters of the vine: and the smell of your nose like apples;
Isa 18:5: For afore the harvest: when the bud is perfect: and the sour grape is ripening in the flower: he will both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks: and take away and cut down the branches.
Isa 55:10: 11: For as the rain comes down: and the snow from heaven: and returns not there: but waters the earth: and makes it bring forth and bud: that it may give seed to the sower: and bread to the eater:
Isa 61:11: For as the earth brings forth her bud: and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
Ho 14:6: His branches will spread: and his beauty will be as the olive tree: and his smell as Lebanon.
Hag 2:19: Is the seed yet in the barn? yes: as yet the vine: and the fig tree: and the pomegranate: and the olive tree: has not brought forth: from this day will I bless you.
Lu 13:6: 7: He spoke also this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon: and found none.

"Arise"
Song 2:10: My beloved spoke: and said to me: Rise up: my love: my fair one: and come away.
Lu 19:42: Saying: If you hadst known: even you: at least in this your day: the things which belong to your peace! but now they are hid from your eyes.
2Co 5:20: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ: as though God did beseech you by us: we pray you in Christ's stead: be you reconciled to God.
2Co 6:1: 2: We then: as workers together with Him: beseech you also that you not receive the grace of God in vain.

14 O my dove, that are in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see your face, let me hear your voice; for sweet is your voice, and your face is comely.Song of Solomon 2:14
Stats
Rank: #9022 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 194 characters, 26 words, 144 letters, 53 vowels, 91 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֹונָתִ֞י בְּחַגְוֵ֣י הַסֶּ֗לַע בְּסֵ֙תֶר֙ הַמַּדְרֵגָ֔ה הַרְאִ֙ינִי֙ אֶת־מַרְאַ֔יִךְ הַשְׁמִיעִ֖ינִי אֶת־קֹולֵ֑ךְ כִּי־קֹולֵ֥ךְ עָרֵ֖ב וּמַרְאֵ֥יךְ נָאוֶֽה׃ ס

Lit: My dove in the clefts of the rock in the secret places of the cliff let me see your face let me hear your voice for your voice is sweet and your face is lovely

KJV: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret [places] of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet [is] thy voice, and thy countenance [is] comely.
References

"my dove"
Song 5:2: I sleep: but my heart wakes: it is the voice of my beloved that knocks: saying: Open to me: my sister: my love: my dove: my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew: and my locks with the drops of the night.
Song 6:9: My dove: my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother: she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her: and blessed her; yes: the queens and the concubines: and they praised her.
Ps 68:13: Though you have lien among the pots: yet will you be as the wings of a dove covered with silver: and her feathers with yellow gold.
Ps 74:19: O not deliver the soul of your turtledove to the multitude of the wicked: not forget the congregation of your poor for ever.
Isa 60:8: Who are these that fly as a cloud: and as the doves to their windows?
Eze 7:16: But they that escape of them will escape: and will be on the mountains like doves of the valleys: all of them mourning: every one for his iniquity.
Mt 3:16: Jesus: when He was baptized: went up straightway out of the water: and: indeed: the heavens were opened to Him: and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove: and lighting upon Him:
Mt 10:16: Look: I send you forth as sheep in the middle of wolves: be you therefore wise as serpents: and harmless as doves.

"that art"
Ex 3:6: Moreover He said: I am the God of your father: the God of Abraham: the God of Isaac: and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid His face; for He was afraid to look upon God.
Ex 4:11-13: The LORD said to Him: Who has made man's mouth? or who makes the dumb: or deaf: or the seeing: or the blind? not have I the LORD?
Ezr 9:5: 6: At the evening sacrifice I arose up from my heaviness; and having tear my garment and my mantle: I fell upon my knees: and spread out my hands to the LORD my God:
Job 9:16: If I had called: and he had answered me; yet would not I believe that he had listened to my voice.
Isa 6:5: Then said I: Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips: and I dwell in the middle of a people of unclean lips: for my eyes have seen the King: the LORD of hosts.
Da 9:7: O Lord: righteousness belongeth to you: but to us confusion of faces: as at this day; to the men of Judah: and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem: and to all Israel: that are near: and that are far off: through all the countries whither you have driven them: because of their trespass that they have trespassed against you.
Lu 8:47: 48: When the woman saw that she not was hid: she came trembling: and falling down before him: she declared to him before all the people for what cause she had touched him: and how she was healed immediately.

"clefts"
Ex 33:22: 23: It will come to pass: while my glory passs by: that I will put you in a clift of the rock: and will cover you with my hand while I pass by:
Isa 2:21: To go into the clefts of the rocks: and into the tops of the ragged rocks: for fear of the LORD: and for the glory of His majesty: when He arises to shake terribly the earth.
Jer 49:16: Your terribleness has deceived you: and the pride of your heart: O you that dwell in the clefts of the rock: that hold the height of the hill: though you should make your nest as high as the eagle: I will bring you down from there: says the LORD.
Ob 1:3: The pride of your heart has deceived you: you that dwell in the clefts of the rock: whose habitation is high; that says in his heart: Who will bring me down to the ground?

"let me hear"
Song 8:13: You that dwell in the gardens: the companions listen to your voice: cause me to hear it.
Ps 50:14: 15: Offer to God thanksgiving; and pay your vows to the most High:
Pr 15:8: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is His delight.
Heb 4:16: Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace: that we may obtain mercy: and find grace to help in time of need.
Heb 10:22: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith: having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience: and our bodies washed with pure water.

"for sweet"
Ps 22:3: But you are holy: O you that inhabit the praises of Israel.
Ps 50:23: Whoever offers praise glorifies me: and to Him that orders His conversation aright will I show the salvation of God.
Isa 51:3: For the LORD will comfort Zion: He will comfort all her waste places; and He will make her wilderness like Eden: and her desert like the garden of the LORD; joy and gladness will be found therein: thanksgiving: and the voice of melody.
Re 4:8-10: The 4 beasts had each of them 6 wings about Him; and they were full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night: saying: Holy: holy: holy: Lord God Almighty: which was: and is: and is to come.
Re 5:8: When he had taken the book: the 4 beasts and 4 and 20 elders fell down before the Lamb: having every one of them harps: and golden vials full of odours: which are the prayers of saints.
Re 7:9: 10: After this I beheld: and: indeed: a great multitude: which no man could number: of all nations: and kindreds: and people: and tongues: stood before the throne: and before the Lamb: clothed with white robes: and palms in their hands;

"thy countenance"
Song 1:5: 8: I am black: but comely: O you daughters of Jerusalem: as the tents of Kedar: as the curtains of Solomon.
Song 6:10: Who is she that looks forth as the morning: fair as the moon: clear as the sun: and terrible as an army with banners?
Ps 45:11: So will the king greatly desire your beauty: for He is your Lord; and worship you Him.
Ps 110:3: Your people will be willing in the day of your power: in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: you have the dew of your youth.
Eph 5:27: That he might present it to himself a glorious church: not having spot: or wrinkle: or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
Col 1:22: In the body of his flesh through death: to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:
1Pe 3:4: But let it be the hidden man of the heart: in that which not is corruptible: even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit: which is in the sight of God of great price.
Jude 1:24: Now to him that is able to keep you from falling: and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy:

H6996קְטַנִּ֖יםqə-ṭan-nîm   (Adj-mp)
H6996 קָטָן qâṭân kaw-tawn or קָטֹן; from קוּט; abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance); least, less(-er), little (one), small(-est, one, quantity, thing), young(-er, -est). 		קְטַנִּ֖יםqə-ṭan-nîm little Adj-mp
H2254מְחַבְּלִ֣יםmə-ḥab-bə-lîm   (V-Piel-Prtcpl-mp)
H2254 חָבַל châbal khaw-bal a primitive root; to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition); idiom at all, band, bring forth, (deal) corrupt(-ly), destroy, offend, lay to (take a) pledge, spoil, travail, idiom very, withhold. 		מְחַבְּלִ֣יםmə-ḥab-bə-lîm that spoil V-Piel-Prtcpl-mp

15 Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.Song of Solomon 2:15
Stats
Rank: #6579 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 92 characters, 14 words, 72 letters, 28 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶֽחֱזוּ־לָ֙נוּ֙ שֽׁוּעָלִ֔ים שֽׁוּעָלִ֥ים קְטַנִּ֖ים מְחַבְּלִ֣ים כְּרָמִ֑ים וּכְרָמֵ֖ינוּ סְמָדַֽר׃

Lit: Catch us the foxes the foxes little that spoil the vines for our vines have tender grapes

KJV: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.
References

"the foxes"
Ps 80:13: The boar out of the wood does waste it: and the wild beast of the field does devour it.
Eze 13:4-16: O Israel: your prophets are like the foxes in the deserts.
Lu 13:32: He said to them: Go you: and tell that fox: Look: I cast out devils: and I do cures today and to morrow: and the third day I will be perfected.
2Pe 2:1-3: But there were false prophets also among the people: even as there will be false teachers among you: who privily will bring in damnable heresies: even denying the Lord that bought them: and bring upon themselves swift destruction.
Re 2:2: I know your works: and your labour: and your patience: and how you not canst bear them which are evil: and you have tried them which say they are apostles: and not are: and have found them liars:

"tender"
Song 2:13: The fig tree puts forth her green figs: and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise: my love: my fair one: and come away.
Song 7:12: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish: whether the tender grape appear: and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give you my loves.

17 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be you like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.Song of Solomon 2:17
Stats
Rank: #8826 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 134 characters, 23 words, 103 letters, 42 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַ֤ד שֶׁיָּפ֙וּחַ֙ הַיֹּ֔ום וְנָ֖סוּ הַצְּלָלִ֑ים סֹב֩ דְּמֵה־לְךָ֙ דֹודִ֜י לִצְבִ֗י אֹ֛ו לְעֹ֥פֶר הָאַיָּלִ֖ים עַל־הָ֥רֵי בָֽתֶר׃ ס

Lit: Until breaks the day and flee away the shadows Turn and be like to me my beloved a gazelle Or young a stag Upon the mountains of Bether

KJV: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
References

"the day"
Song 4:6: Until the day break: and the shadows flee away: I will get me to the mountain of myrrh: and to the hill of frankincense.
Lu 1:78: Through the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high has visited us:
Ro 13:12: The night is far spent: the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness: and let us put on the armour of light.
2Pe 1:19: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; to what you do well that you take heed: as to a light that shines in a dark place: until the day dawn: and the day star arise in your hearts:

"the shadows"
Heb 8:5: Who serve to the example and shadow of heavenly things: as Moses was admonished of God when He was about to make the tabernacle: for: See: says He: that you make all things according to the pattern showed to you in the mount.
Heb 10:1: For the law having a shadow of good things to come: and not the very image of the things: can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

"beloved"
Song 2:9: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: look: he stands behind our wall: he looks forth at the windows: shewing himself through the lattice.
Song 8:14: Make haste: my beloved: and be you like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.

H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		וְלֹ֥אwə-lō but not Conj-w | Adv-NegPrt
H4672מְצָאתִֽיו׃mə-ṣā-ṯîw.   (V-Qal-Perf-1cs | 3ms)
H4672 מָצָא mâtsâʼ maw-tsaw a primitive root; properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present; phrase be able, befall, being, catch, idiom certainly, (cause to) come (on, to, to hand), deliver, be enough (cause to) find(-ing, occasion, out), get (hold upon), idiom have (here), be here, hit, be left, light (up-) on, meet (with), idiom occasion serve, (be) present, ready, speed, suffice, take hold on. 		מְצָאתִֽיו׃mə-ṣā-ṯîw. I did find him V-Qal-Perf-1cs | 3ms
1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loves: I sought him, but I found not him.Song of Solomon 3:1
Stats
Counts: 87 characters, 18 words, 65 letters, 22 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַל־מִשְׁכָּבִי֙ בַּלֵּילֹ֔ות בִּקַּ֕שְׁתִּי אֵ֥ת שֶׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֖יו וְלֹ֥א מְצָאתִֽיו׃

Lit: On my bed by night I sought the one love I I sought him but not I did find him

KJV: By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
References

"night"
Ps 4:4: Stand in awe: and not sin: commune with your own heart upon your bed: and be still. Selah.
Ps 6:6: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
Ps 22:2: O my God: I cry in the daytime: but you hear not; and in the night season: and not am silent.
Ps 63:6-8: When I remember you upon my bed: and meditate on you in the night watches.
Ps 77:2-4: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night: and not ceased: my soul refused to be comforted.
Isa 26:9: With my soul have I desired you in the night; yes: with my spirit within me will I seek you early: for when your judgments are in the earth: the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

"him whom"
Song 1:7: Tell me: O you whom my soul loves: where you feed: where you make your flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turns aside by the flocks of your companions?
Song 5:8: I charge you: O daughters of Jerusalem: if you find my beloved: that you tell him: that I am sick of love.
Joh 21:17: He says to Him the third time: Simon: son of Jonas: love'>love you me? Peter was grieved because He said to Him the third time: Love'>Love you me? And He said to Him: Lord: you know'>know all things; you know'>know that I love you. Jesus says to Him: Feed my sheep.
1Pe 1:8: Whom not having seen: you love; in whom: though now you see him not: yet believing: you rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

"I sought him, but"
Song 5:6: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself: and was gone: my soul failed when he spoke: I sought him: but I not could find him; I called him: but he gave me no answer.
Job 23:8: 9: Look: I go forward: but he is not there; and backward: but I cannot perceive him:
Ps 130:1: 2: > Out of the depths have I cried to you: O LORD.
Isa 55:6: Seek you the LORD while He may be found: call you upon Him while He is near:
Lu 13:24: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many: I say to you: will seek to enter in: and will not be able.

 אָק֨וּמָה נָּ֜א וַאֲסֹובְבָ֣ה בָעִ֗יר בַּשְּׁוָקִים֙ וּבָ֣רְחֹבֹ֔ות אֲבַקְשָׁ֕ה אֵ֥ת שֶׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֖יו וְלֹ֥א מְצָאתִֽיו׃

2 I will rise now, and go about the city in the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loves: I sought him, but I found not him.Song of Solomon 3:2
Stats
Counts: 148 characters, 29 words, 111 letters, 42 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אָק֨וּמָה נָּ֜א וַאֲסֹובְבָ֣ה בָעִ֗יר בַּשְּׁוָקִים֙ וּבָ֣רְחֹבֹ֔ות אֲבַקְשָׁ֕ה אֵ֥ת שֶׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֖יו וְלֹ֥א מְצָאתִֽיו׃

Lit: I will rise I said now and go about the city in the streets and in the squares I will seek the one love I I sought him but not I did find him

KJV: I will rise now, and go about the city in the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

"will rise"

Joh 1:6: There was a man sent from God: whose name was John.
Mt 26:40: 41: He comes to the disciples: and finds them asleep: and says to Peter: What: could you not watch with me one hour?
Ro 13:11: That: knowing the time: that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.
1Co 15:34: Awake to righteousness: and not sin; for some not have the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
Eph 5:14: For what reason He says: Awake you that sleep: and arise from the dead: and Christ will give you light.

"the streets"

Pr 8:2: 3: 34: She stands in the top of high places: by the way in the places of the paths.

"I sought"

Ps 43:2-5: For you are the God of my strength: why do you cast me off? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
Ps 77:7-10: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will He be favourable no more?

3 The watchmen that go about the city found me: to whom I said, Saw you him whom my soul loveth?Song of Solomon 3:3
Stats
Counts: 93 characters, 18 words, 71 letters, 26 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מְצָא֙וּנִי֙ הַשֹּׁ֣מְרִ֔ים הַסֹּבְבִ֖ים בָּעִ֑יר אֵ֛ת שֶׁאָהֲבָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י רְאִיתֶֽם׃

Lit: Found me the watchmen who go about the city the one love I I said have you seen

KJV: The watchmen that go about the city found me: to whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?
References

"watchmen"
Song 5:7: The watchmen that went about the city found me: they smote me: they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.
Isa 21:6-8: 11: 12: For thus has the Lord said to me: Go: set a watchman: let Him declare what He seeth.
Isa 56:10: His watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant: they are all dumb dogs: they cannot bark; sleeping: lying down: loving to slumber.
Isa 62:6: I have set watchmen upon your walls: O Jerusalem: which will never hold their peace day nor night: you that make mention of the LORD: not keep silence:
Eze 3:17: Son of man: I have made you a watchman to the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth: and give them warning from me.
Eze 33:2-9: Son of man: speak to the children of your people: and say to them: When I bring the sword upon a land: if the people of the land take a man of their coasts: and set Him for their watchman:
Heb 13:17: Obey them that have the rule over you: and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls: as they that must give account: that they may do it with joy: not and with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

"Saw"
Joh 20:15: Jesus says to her: Woman: why weep you? whom seek you? She: supposing Him to be the gardener: says to Him: Sir: if you have borne Him here: tell me where you have laid Him: and I will take Him away.

H5674 עָבַר ʻâbar aw-bar a primitive root; to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation); alienate, alter, idiom at all, beyond, bring (over, through), carry over, (over-) come (on, over), conduct (over), convey over, current, deliver, do away, enter, escape, fail, gender, get over, (make) go (away, beyond, by, forth, his way, in, on, over, through), have away (more), lay, meddle, overrun, make partition, (cause to, give, make to, over) pass(-age, along, away, beyond, by, -enger, on, out, over, through), (cause to, make) phrase proclaim(-amation), perish, provoke to anger, put away, rage, phrase raiser of taxes, remove, send over, set apart, phrase shave, cause to (make) sound, idiom speedily, idiom sweet smelling, take (away), (make to) transgress(-or), translate, turn away, (way-) faring man, be wrath. 		שֶׁעָבַ֣רְתִּיše-‘ā-ḇar-tî had I passed Pro-r | V-Qal-Perf-1cs

4 It was but a little that I passed from them, but I found him whom my soul loves: I held him, and not would let him go, until I had brought him into my mother's house, and into the chamber of her that conceived me.Song of Solomon 3:4
Stats
Rank: #5867 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 214 characters, 40 words, 163 letters, 60 vowels, 103 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּמְעַט֙ שֶׁעָבַ֣רְתִּי מֵהֶ֔ם עַ֣ד שֶֽׁמָּצָ֔אתִי אֵ֥ת שֶׁאָהֲבָ֖ה נַפְשִׁ֑י אֲחַזְתִּיו֙ וְלֹ֣א אַרְפֶּ֔נּוּ עַד־שֶׁ֤הֲבֵיאתִיו֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אִמִּ֔י וְאֶל־חֶ֖דֶר הֹורָתִֽי׃

Lit: Scarcely had I passed by them when I found the one love I I held him and not would let him go Until I had brought him to the house of my mother and into the chamber of her who conceived me

KJV: It was but a little that I passed from them, but I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, until I had brought him into my mother's house, and into the chamber of her that conceived me.
References

"but"
Song 6:12: Or ever I was aware: my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
Pr 8:17: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early will find me.
Isa 45:19: I not have spoken in secret: in a dark place of the earth: I not said to the seed of Jacob: Seek you me in vain: I the LORD speak righteousness: I declare things that are right.
Isa 55:6: 7: Seek you the LORD while He may be found: call you upon Him while He is near:
Jer 29:13: you will seek me: and find me: when you will search for me with all your heart.
La 3:25: The LORD is good to them that wait for Him: to the soul that seeks Him.
Mt 7:7: Ask: and it will be given you; seek: and you will find; knock: and it will be opened to you:

"I held"
Song 7:5: Your head upon you is like Carmel: and the hair of your head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.
Ge 32:26: He said: Let me go: for the day breaks. And he said: I not will let you go: except you bless me.
Pr 4:13: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is your life.
Ho 12:3: 4: He took His brother by the heel in the womb: and by His strength He had power with God:
Mt 28:9: As they went to tell His disciples: look: Jesus met them: saying: All hail. And they came and held Him by the feet: and worshipped Him.
Joh 20:16: 17: Jesus says to her: Mary. She turned herself: and says to Him: Rabboni; which is to say: Master.
Re 3:11: 12: Look: I come quickly: hold that fast which you have: that no man take your crown.

"I had"
Isa 49:14-18: But Zion said: The LORD has forsaken me: and my Lord has forgotten me.
Isa 54:1-3: Sing: O barren: you that did not bear; break forth into singing: and cry aloud: you that did not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife: says the LORD.
Ga 4:26: But Jerusalem which is above is free: which is the mother of us all.

5 I charge you, O you daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that you not stir up, nor awake my love, till he please.Song of Solomon 3:5
Stats
Rank: #7991 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 142 characters, 24 words, 106 letters, 41 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֨עְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֜ם בְּנֹ֤ות יְרוּשָׁלִַ֙ם֙ בִּצְבָאֹ֔ות אֹ֖ו בְּאַיְלֹ֣ות הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה אִם־תָּעִ֧ירוּ ׀ וְֽאִם־תְּעֹֽורְר֛וּ אֶת־הָאַהֲבָ֖ה עַ֥ד שֶׁתֶּחְפָּֽץ׃ ס

Lit: I charge you daughters of Jerusalem by the gazelles or by the does of the field not do stir up nor awaken love Until it pleases please

KJV: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
References

"I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please."

Song 8:4: I charge you: O daughters of Jerusalem: that you not stir up: nor awake my love: until he please.
Mic 4:8: you: O tower of the flock: the strong hold of the daughter of Zion: to you will it come: even the first dominion; the kingdom will come to the daughter of Jerusalem.

 מִ֣י זֹ֗את עֹלָה֙ מִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר כְּתִֽימֲרֹ֖ות עָשָׁ֑ן מְקֻטֶּ֤רֶת מֹור֙ וּלְבֹונָ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל אַבְקַ֥ת רֹוכֵֽל׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H4310מִ֣יmî   (Interrog)
H4310 מִי mîy me an interrogative pronoun of persons, as מָה is of things,; who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix; any (man), idiom he, idiom him, phrase O that! what, which, who(-m, -se, -soever), phrase would to God., 		מִ֣יmî Who is Interrog

6 Who is this that comes out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant?Song of Solomon 3:6
Stats
Counts: 140 characters, 22 words, 114 letters, 37 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִ֣י זֹ֗את עֹלָה֙ מִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר כְּתִֽימֲרֹ֖ות עָשָׁ֑ן מְקֻטֶּ֤רֶת מֹור֙ וּלְבֹונָ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל אַבְקַ֥ת רֹוכֵֽל׃

Lit: Who is this coming out of the wilderness Like pillars of smoke Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense with all fragrant powders of the merchant

KJV: Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant?
References

"this"
Song 8:5: Who is this that comes up from the wilderness: leaning upon her beloved? I raised you up under the apple tree: there your mother brought you forth: there she brought you forth that bare you.
De 8:2: you will remember all the way which the LORD your God led you these 40 years in the wilderness: to humble you: and to prove you: to know what was in your heart: whether you would keep His commandments: or no.
Isa 43:19: Look: I will do a new thing; now it will spring forth; will you not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness: and rivers in the desert.
Jer 2:2: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; I remember you: the kindness of your youth: the love of your espousals: when you went after me in the wilderness: in a land that was not sown.
Jer 31:2: Thus says the LORD: The people which were left of the sword found grace in the wilderness; even Israel: when I went to cause Him to rest.
Re 12:6: 14: The woman fled into the wilderness: where she has a place prepared of God: that they should feed her there a000 200 and threescore days.

"like"
Ex 13:21: 22: The LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud: to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire: to give them light; to go by day and night:
Joe 2:29-31: Also upon the servants and upon the handmaids in those days will I pour out my spirit.
Ac 2:18-21: On my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they will prophesy:
Col 3:1: 2: If you then be risen with Christ: seek those things which are above: where Christ sits on the right hand of God.

"perfumed"
Song 1:3: 13: Because of the savour of your good ointments your name is as ointment poured forth: therefore do the virgins love you.
Song 4:12-14: A garden inclosed is my sister: my spouse; a spring shut up: a fountain sealed.
Song 5:5: 13: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh: and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh: upon the handles of the lock.
2Co 2:14-16: Now thanks be to God: which always causes us to triumph in Christ: and makes manifest the savour of His knowledge by us in every place.
Php 4:18: But I have all: and abound: I am full: having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you: an odour of a sweet smell: a sacrifice acceptable: wellpleasing to God.
Re 5:8: When he had taken the book: the 4 beasts and 4 and 20 elders fell down before the Lamb: having every one of them harps: and golden vials full of odours: which are the prayers of saints.

Stats

Translation

KJV: Behold his bed, which is Solomon's; threescore valiant men [are] about it, of the valiant of Israel.

8 They all hold swords, being expert in war: every man has his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.Song of Solomon 3:8
Stats
Counts: 114 characters, 18 words, 88 letters, 30 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֻּלָּם֙ אֲחֻ֣זֵי חֶ֔רֶב מְלֻמְּדֵ֖י מִלְחָמָ֑ה אִ֤ישׁ חַרְבֹּו֙ עַל־יְרֵכֹ֔ו מִפַּ֖חַד בַּלֵּילֹֽות׃ ס

Lit: They all hold swords Being expert in war every man has his sword on his thigh because of fear in the night

KJV: They all hold swords, being expert in war: every man [hath] his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.
References

"all"

Ps 149:5-9: Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.
Isa 27:3: I the LORD do keep it; I will water it every moment: lest any hurt it: I will keep it night and day.
Eph 6:16-18: Above all: taking the shield of faith: wherewith you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.

"because"
Ne 4:21: 22: So we laboured in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared.
1Th 5:6-8: Therefore let not us sleep: as do others; but let us watch and be sober.

KJV: King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.

Translation
Hebrew: עַמּוּדָיו֙ עָ֣שָׂה כֶ֔סֶף רְפִידָתֹ֣ו זָהָ֔ב מֶרְכָּבֹ֖ו אַרְגָּמָ֑ן תֹּוכֹו֙ רָצ֣וּף אַהֲבָ֔ה מִבְּנֹ֖ות יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: Its pillars He made of silver Its support of gold Its seat of purple Its interior paved with love by the daughters of Jerusalem

KJV: He made the pillars thereof of silver, the bottom thereof [of] gold, the covering of it [of] purple, the midst thereof being paved [with] love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.

11 Go forth, O you daughters of Zion, and look king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals, and in the day of the gladness of his heart.Song of Solomon 3:11
Stats
Counts: 179 characters, 32 words, 141 letters, 50 vowels, 91 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: צְאֶ֧ינָה ׀ וּֽרְאֶ֛ינָה בְּנֹ֥ות צִיֹּ֖ון בַּמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה בָּעֲטָרָ֗ה שֶׁעִטְּרָה־לֹּ֤ו אִמֹּו֙ בְּיֹ֣ום חֲתֻנָּתֹ֔ו וּבְיֹ֖ום שִׂמְחַ֥ת לִבֹּֽו׃ ס

Lit: Go forth and see daughters of Zion King Solomon with the crown with which crowned him his mother On the day of his wedding and the day of the gladness of his heart

KJV: Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals, and in the day of the gladness of his heart.
References

"Go"
Song 7:11: Come: my beloved: let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.
Heb 13:13: Let us go forth therefore to him without the camp: bearing his reproach.

"O ye"
Song 1:5: I am black: but comely: O you daughters of Jerusalem: as the tents of Kedar: as the curtains of Solomon.
Song 2:7: I charge you: O you daughters of Jerusalem: by the roes: and by the hinds of the field: that you not stir up: nor awake my love: till he please.
Ps 9:14: That I may show forth all your praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in your salvation.
Ps 48:11: Let mount Zion rejoice: let the daughters of Judah be glad: because of your judgments.

"behold"
Isa 9:6: For to us a child is born: to us a son is given: and the government will be upon His shoulder: and His name will be called Wonderful: Counseller: The mighty God: The everlasting Father: The Prince of Peace.
Mt 12:42: The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation: and will condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and: look: a greater than Solomon is here.
Php 2:9-11: For what reason God also has highly exalted Him: and given Him a name which is above every name:
Heb 2:9: But we see Jesus: who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death: crowned with glory and honour; that He by the grace of God should taste death for every man.
Re 1:7: Look: he comes with clouds; and every eye will see him: and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth will wail because of him. Even so: Amen.
Re 19:12: His eyes were as a flame of fire: and on his head were many crowns; and he had a name written: that no man knew: but he himself.

"his mother"
Song 8:5: Who is this that comes up from the wilderness: leaning upon her beloved? I raised you up under the apple tree: there your mother brought you forth: there she brought you forth that bare you.
Col 1:18: He is the head of the body: the church: who is the beginning: the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.
Re 5:9: 10: They sung a new song: saying: You are worthy to take the book: and to open the seals thereof: for you were killed: and have redeemed us to God by your blood out of every kindred: and tongue: and people: and nation;

"in the day of his"
Isa 62:5: For as a young man marries a virgin: so will your sons marry you: and as the groom rejoices over the bride: so will your God rejoice over you.
Jer 2:2: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; I remember you: the kindness of your youth: the love of your espousals: when you went after me in the wilderness: in a land that was not sown.
Ho 2:19: 20: I will betroth you to me for ever; yes: I will betroth you to me in righteousness: and in judgment: and in lovingkindness: and in mercies.
Joh 3:29: He who has the bride is the groom: but the friend of the groom: which stands and hears him: rejoices greatly because of the groom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
Re 19:7: Let us be glad and rejoice: and give honour to him: for the marriage of the Lamb is come: and his wife has made herself ready.
Re 22:9: 10: Then says He to me: See you do it not: for I am your fellowservant: and of your brothers the prophets: and of them which keep the sayings of this book: worship God.

"in the day of the"
Isa 53:11: He will see of the travail of his soul: and will be satisfied: by his knowledge will my righteous servant justify many; for he will bear their iniquities.
Jer 32:41: Yes: I will rejoice over them to do them good: and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.
Zep 3:17: The LORD your God in the middle of you is mighty; He will save: He will rejoice over you with joy; He will rest in His love: He will joy over you with singing.
Lu 15:6: 7: 23: 24: 32: When he comes home: he calls together his friends and neighbours: saying to them: Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
Joh 15:11: These things have I spoken to you: that my joy might remain in you: and that your joy might be full.

4

הִנָּ֨ךְ יָפָ֤ה רַעְיָתִי֙ הִנָּ֣ךְ יָפָ֔ה עֵינַ֣יִךְ יֹונִ֔ים מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵ֑ךְ שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הָֽעִזִּ֔ים שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ מֵהַ֥ר גִּלְעָֽד׃

H1568 גִּלְעָד Gilʻâd ghil-awd probably from גַּלְעֵד; Gilad, a region East of the Jordan; also the name of three Israelites; Gilead, Gileadite., 		גִּלְעָֽד׃gil-‘āḏ. Gilead N-proper-fs
1 <a class='u' title='Behold'>Look, you are fair, my love; look, you are fair; you have doves' eyes within your locks: your hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.Song of Solomon 4:1
Stats
Counts: 164 characters, 16 words, 120 letters, 45 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִנָּ֨ךְ יָפָ֤ה רַעְיָתִי֙ הִנָּ֣ךְ יָפָ֔ה עֵינַ֣יִךְ יֹונִ֔ים מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵ֑ךְ שַׂעְרֵךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הָֽעִזִּ֔ים שֶׁגָּלְשׁ֖וּ מֵהַ֥ר גִּלְעָֽד׃

Lit: Behold you are fair my love behold you are fair You have eyes doves inside behind your veil Your hair is like a flock of goats Going down from Mount Gilead

KJV: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou [art] fair; thou [hast] doves' eyes within thy locks: thy hair [is] as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.
References

"thou art fair, my"
Song 4:9: 10: You have ravished my heart: my sister: my spouse; you have ravished my heart with one of your eyes: with one chain of your neck.
Song 1:15: Look: you are fair: my love; look: you are fair; you have doves' eyes.
Song 2:10: 14: My beloved spoke: and said to me: Rise up: my love: my fair one: and come away.
Ps 45:11: So will the king greatly desire your beauty: for He is your Lord; and worship you Him.
Eze 16:14: your renown went forth among the heathen for your beauty: for it was perfect through my comeliness: which I had put upon you: says the Lord GOD.
2Co 3:18: But we all: with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord: are changed into the same image from glory to glory: even as by the Spirit of the Lord.

"thou hast"
Song 5:12: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters: washed with milk: and fitly set.
Mt 11:29: Take my yoke upon you: and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and you will find rest to your souls.
Php 2:3-5: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

"thy hair"
Song 5:11: His head is as the most fine gold: his locks are bushy: and black as a raven.
Song 6:5: 7: Turn away your eyes from me: for they have overcome me: your hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
Song 7:5: Your head upon you is like Carmel: and the hair of your head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.

"mount"
Nu 32:1: 40: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of cattle: and when they saw the land of Jazer: and the land of Gilead: that: look: the place was a place for cattle;
