2 Your teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.Song of Solomon 4:2
Stats
Counts: 153 characters, 22 words, 117 letters, 44 vowels, 73 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הַקְּצוּבֹ֔ות שֶׁעָל֖וּ מִן־הָרַחְצָ֑ה שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ מַתְאִימֹ֔ות וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה אֵ֥ין בָּהֶֽם׃

Lit: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep shorn which have come up from the washing of which every one bears twins and barren none is among them

KJV: Thy teeth are like a flock [of sheep that are even] shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none [is] barren among them.
References

"teeth"
Song 6:6: Your teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing: whereof every one bears twins: and there is not one barren among them.
Jer 15:16: Your words were found: and I did eat them; and your word was to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart: for I am called by your name: O LORD God of hosts.
Joh 15:7: If you abide in me: and my words abide in you: you will ask what you will: and it will be done to you.
Col 1:4-6: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus: and of the love which you have to all the saints:
1Th 2:13: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing: because: when you received the word of God which you heard of us: you received it not as the word of men: but as it is in truth: the word of God: which effectually works also in you that believe.
2Pe 1:5-8: Beside this: giving all diligence: add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

"and none"
Ex 23:26: There will nothing cast their young: nor be barren: in your land: the number of your days I will fulfil.
De 7:13: 14: He will love you: and bless you: and multiply you: he will also bless the fruit of your womb: and the fruit of your land: your grain: and your wine: and your oil: the increase of your cattle: and the flocks of your sheep: in the land which he sware to your fathers to give you.

3 Your lips are like a thread of scarlet, and your speech is comely: your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within your locks.Song of Solomon 4:3
Stats
Counts: 132 characters, 19 words, 101 letters, 37 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּח֤וּט הַשָּׁנִי֙ שִׂפְתֹתַ֔יִךְ וּמִדְבָּרֵ֖יךְ נָאוֶ֑ה כְּפֶ֤לַח הָֽרִמֹּון֙ רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃

Lit: Like a strand of scarlet Your lips are and your mouth is lovely Are like a piece of pomegranate Your temples inside behind your veil

KJV: Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech [is] comely: thy temples [are] like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.
References

"lips"
Song 4:11: Your lips: O my spouse: drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under your tongue; and the smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
Song 5:13: 16: His cheeks are as a bed of spices: as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies: dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
Song 7:9: The roof of your mouth like the best wine for my beloved: that goes down sweetly: causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.
Ps 37:30: The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom: and his tongue talks of judgment.
Ps 45:2: You are fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into your lips: therefore God has blessed you for ever.
Ps 119:13: With my lips have I declared all the judgments of your mouth.
Pr 10:13: 20: 21: In the lips of him that has understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
Pr 16:21-24: The wise in heart will be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increases learning.
Mt 12:35: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart brings'>brings forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure brings'>brings forth evil things.
Lu 4:22: All bare him witness: and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said: not Is this Joseph's son?
2Co 5:18-21: All things are of God: who has reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ: and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation;
Eph 4:29: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth: but that which is good to the use of edifying: that it may minister grace to the hearers.
Col 3:16: 17: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs: singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
Col 4:6: Let your speech be alway with grace: seasoned with salt: that you may know how you ought to answer every man.

"scarlet"
Le 14:4: 6: 49-52: Then will the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive and clean: and cedar wood: and scarlet: and hyssop:
Nu 4:8: They will spread upon them a cloth of scarlet: and cover the same with a covering of badgers' skins: and will put in the staves thereof.
Nu 19:6: The priest will take cedar wood: and hyssop: and scarlet: and cast it into the middle of the burning of the heifer.
Jos 2:18: Look: when we come into the land: you will bind this line of scarlet thread in the window which you did let us down by: and you will bring your father: and your mother: and your brothers: and all your father's household: home to you.
Pr 31:26: She opens her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
Heb 9:19: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law: he took the blood of calves and of goats: with water: and scarlet wool: and hyssop: and sprinkled both the book: and all the people:

"thy temples"
Song 6:7: As a piece of a pomegranate are your temples within your locks.
Ge 32:10: I not am worthy of the least of all the mercies: and of all the truth: which you have showed to your servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two bands.
Ezr 9:6: Said: O my God: I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to you: my God: for our iniquities are increased over our head: and our trespass is grown up to the heavens.
Eze 16:63: That you may remember: and be confounded: and never open your mouth any more because of your shame: when I am pacified toward you for all that you have done: says the Lord GOD.

4 Your neck is like the tower of David built for an armoury, whereon there hang a000 bucklers, all shields of mighty men.Song of Solomon 4:4
Stats
Counts: 126 characters, 21 words, 101 letters, 36 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּמִגְדַּ֤ל דָּוִיד֙ צַוָּארֵ֔ךְ בָּנ֖וּי לְתַלְפִּיֹּ֑ות אֶ֤לֶף הַמָּגֵן֙ תָּל֣וּי עָלָ֔יו כֹּ֖ל שִׁלְטֵ֥י הַגִּבֹּורִֽים׃

Lit: Like the tower of David Your neck is Built for an armory a thousand bucklers hang On which all shields of mighty men

KJV: Thy neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.
References

"neck"
Song 1:10: Your cheeks are comely with rows of jewels: your neck with chains of gold.
Song 7:4: Your neck is as a tower of ivory; your eyes like the fishpools in Heshbon: by the gate of Bathrabbim: your nose is as the tower of Lebanon which looks toward Damascus.
2Sa 22:51: He is the tower of salvation for his king: and shews mercy to his anointed: to David: and to his seed for evermore.
Eph 4:15: 16: But speaking the truth in love: may grow up into Him in all things: which is the head: even Christ:
Col 2:19: not And holding the Head: from which all the body by joints and bands having nourishment ministered: and knit together: increases with the increase of God.
1Pe 1:5: Who are kept by the power of God through faith to salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

"an armoury"
Ne 3:19: Next to him repaired Ezer the son of Jeshua: the ruler of Mizpah: another piece over against the going up to the armoury at the turning of the wall.

"a thousand"
2Ch 9:15: 16: King Solomon made 200 targets of beaten gold: 600 shekels of beaten gold went to one target.
2Ch 12:9-11: So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem: and took away the treasures of the house of the LORD: and the treasures of the king's house; He took all: He carried away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.

"two breasts"

1Pe 2:2: As newborn babes: desire the sincere milk of the word: that you may grow thereby:

"feed"

Song 6:3: I am my beloved's: and my beloved is my: he feeds among the lilies.

6 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.Song of Solomon 4:6
Stats
Rank: #7289 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 120 characters, 21 words, 93 letters, 34 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַ֤ד שֶׁיָּפ֙וּחַ֙ הַיֹּ֔ום וְנָ֖סוּ הַצְּלָלִ֑ים אֵ֤לֶךְ לִי֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר הַמֹּ֔ור וְאֶל־גִּבְעַ֖ת הַלְּבֹונָֽה׃

Lit: Until breaks the day and flee away the shadows I will go my way to the mountain of myrrh and to the hill of frankincense

KJV: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
References

"day"

Mal 4:2: But to you that fear my name will the Sun of righteousness arise with healing in his wings; and you will go forth: and grow up as calves of the stall.
Lu 1:78: Through the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high has visited us:
2Pe 1:19: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; to what you do well that you take heed: as to a light that shines in a dark place: until the day dawn: and the day star arise in your hearts:
1Jo 2:8: Again: a new commandment I write to you: which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past: and the true light now shines.
Re 22:16: I Jesus have sent my angel to testify to you these things in the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David: and the bright and morning star.

"the mountain"

H3605כֻּלָּ֤ךְkul-lāḵ   (N-msc | 2fs)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כֻּלָּ֤ךְkul-lāḵ You are all N-msc | 2fs

H369אֵ֥ין’ên   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. 7 You are all fair, my love; there is no spot in you.Song of Solomon 4:7

Translation
Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֤ךְ יָפָה֙ רַעְיָתִ֔י וּמ֖וּם אֵ֥ין בָּֽךְ׃ ס

Lit: You are all fair my love and spot there is no in you

KJV: Thou art all fair, my love; [there is] no spot in thee.

"Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee."

2Pe 3:14: For what reason: beloved: seeing that you look for such things: be diligent that you may be found of him in peace: without spot: and blameless.

Re 21:2: I John saw the holy city: new Jerusalem: coming down from God out of heaven: prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

 אִתִּ֤י מִלְּבָנֹון֙ כַּלָּ֔ה אִתִּ֖י מִלְּבָנֹ֣ון תָּבֹ֑ואִי תָּשׁ֣וּרִי ׀ מֵרֹ֣אשׁ אֲמָנָ֗ה מֵרֹ֤אשׁ שְׂנִיר֙ וְחֶרְמֹ֔ון מִמְּעֹנֹ֣ות אֲרָיֹ֔ות מֵֽהַרְרֵ֖י נְמֵרִֽים׃

8 Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions' dens, from the mountains of the leopards.Song of Solomon 4:8
Stats
Rank: #8152 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 180 characters, 27 words, 139 letters, 51 vowels, 88 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִתִּ֤י מִלְּבָנֹון֙ כַּלָּ֔ה אִתִּ֖י מִלְּבָנֹ֣ון תָּבֹ֑ואִי תָּשׁ֣וּרִי ׀ מֵרֹ֣אשׁ אֲמָנָ֗ה מֵרֹ֤אשׁ שְׂנִיר֙ וְחֶרְמֹ֔ון מִמְּעֹנֹ֣ות אֲרָיֹ֔ות מֵֽהַרְרֵ֖י נְמֵרִֽים׃

Lit: With me from Lebanon my spouse with me from Lebanon come Look from the top of Abanah from the top of Senir and Hermon from the dens lions from the mountains of the leopards

KJV: Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions' dens, from the mountains of the leopards.

"with me"

Song 7:11: Come: my beloved: let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.
Ps 45:10: Listen: O daughter: and consider: and incline your ear; forget also your own people: and your father's house;
Pr 9:6: Forsake the foolish: and live; and go in the way of understanding.
Joh 12:26: If any man serve me: let Him follow me; and where I am: there will also my servant be: if any man serve me: Him will my Father honour.
Col 3:1: 2: If you then be risen with Christ: seek those things which are above: where Christ sits on the right hand of God.

"from Lebanon"

"Shenir"

"from the lions'"

H3823לִבַּבְתִּ֖נִיlib-baḇ-ti-nî   (V-Piel-Perf-2fs | 1cs)

9 You have ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; you have ravished my heart with one of your eyes, with one chain of your neck.Song of Solomon 4:9
Stats
Counts: 130 characters, 21 words, 101 letters, 36 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לִבַּבְתִּ֖נִי אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה לִבַּבְתִּ֙ינִי֙ [בְּאַחַד כ] (בְּאַחַ֣ת ק) מֵעֵינַ֔יִךְ בְּאַחַ֥ד עֲנָ֖ק מִצַּוְּרֹנָֽיִךְ׃

Lit: You have ravished my heart my sister my spouse You have ravished My heart with one with one look of your eyes with one link of your necklace

KJV: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.
References

"my sister"
Song 4:10: 12: How fair is your love: my sister: my spouse! how much better is your love than wine! and the smell of your ointments than all spices!
Song 5:1: 2: I am come into my garden: my sister: my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat: O friends; drink: yes: drink abundantly: O beloved.
Ge 20:12: Yet indeed she is my sister; she is the daughter of my father: not but the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.
Mt 12:50: For whoever will do the will of my Father which is in heaven: the same is my brother: and sister: and mother.
1Co 9:5: Have not we power to lead about a sister: a wife: as well as other apostles: and as the brothers of the Lord: and Cephas?
Heb 2:11-14: For both he who sanctifies and they who are sanctified are all of one: for which cause he not is ashamed to call them brothers:

"my spouse"
Song 3:11: Go forth: O you daughters of Zion: and look king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals: and in the day of the gladness of his heart.
Ps 45:9: Kings' daughters were among your honourable women: upon your right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
Isa 54:5: For your Maker is your husband; the LORD of hosts is His name; and your Redeemer the Holy one of Israel; The God of the whole earth will He be called.
Isa 62:5: For as a young man marries a virgin: so will your sons marry you: and as the groom rejoices over the bride: so will your God rejoice over you.
Eze 16:8: Now when I passed by you: and looked upon you: look: your time was the time of love; and I spread my skirt over you: and covered your nakedness: yes: I sware to you: and entered into a covenant with you: says the Lord GOD: and you became my.
Ho 2:19: 20: I will betroth you to me for ever; yes: I will betroth you to me in righteousness: and in judgment: and in lovingkindness: and in mercies.
Joh 3:29: He who has the bride is the groom: but the friend of the groom: which stands and hears him: rejoices greatly because of the groom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
2Co 11:2: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband: that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.
Re 19:7: 8: Let us be glad and rejoice: and give honour to him: for the marriage of the Lamb is come: and his wife has made herself ready.
Re 21:2: 9: 10: I John saw the holy city: new Jerusalem: coming down from God out of heaven: prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

"thou hast"
Song 6:12: Or ever I was aware: my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
Song 7:5: 6: 10: Your head upon you is like Carmel: and the hair of your head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.
Pr 5:19: 20: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy you at all times; and be you ravished always with her love.
Zep 3:17: The LORD your God in the middle of you is mighty; He will save: He will rejoice over you with joy; He will rest in His love: He will joy over you with singing.

"with one of"
Song 1:15: Look: you are fair: my love; look: you are fair; you have doves' eyes.
Song 6:5: Turn away your eyes from me: for they have overcome me: your hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

"one chain"
Song 1:10: Your cheeks are comely with rows of jewels: your neck with chains of gold.

 מַה־יָּפ֥וּ דֹדַ֖יִךְ אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה מַה־טֹּ֤בוּ דֹדַ֙יִךְ֙ מִיַּ֔יִן וְרֵ֥יחַ שְׁמָנַ֖יִךְ מִכָּל־בְּשָׂמִֽים׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H4100מַה־mah-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- How Interrog
H3302יָּפ֥וּyā-p̄ū   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H3302 יָפָה yâphâh yaw-faw a primitive root; properly, to be bright, i.e. (by implication) beautiful; be beautiful, be (make self) fair(-r), deck. 		יָּפ֥וּyā-p̄ū fair is V-Qal-Perf-3cp
H1730דֹדַ֖יִךְḏō-ḏa-yiḵ   (N-mpc | 2fs)
H1730 דּוֹד dôwd dode or (shortened) דֹּד; from an unused root meaning properly, to boil, i.e.; (figuratively) to love; by implication, a love-token, lover, friend; specifically an uncle; (well-) beloved, fathers brother, love, uncle. 		דֹדַ֖יִךְḏō-ḏa-yiḵ your love N-mpc | 2fs

(including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- how Interrog

10 How fair is your love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is your love than wine! and the smell of your ointments than all spices!Song of Solomon 4:10
Stats
Counts: 132 characters, 22 words, 102 letters, 34 vowels, 68 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מַה־יָּפ֥וּ דֹדַ֖יִךְ אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה מַה־טֹּ֤בוּ דֹדַ֙יִךְ֙ מִיַּ֔יִן וְרֵ֥יחַ שְׁמָנַ֖יִךְ מִכָּל־בְּשָׂמִֽים׃

Lit: How fair is your love My sister my spouse how much better is your love than wine and the scent of your perfumes Than all spices

KJV: How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!
References

"love"
Song 1:2: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for your love is better than wine.

"how much"
Song 1:2: 4: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for your love is better than wine.

"the smell"
Song 1:3: 12: Because of the savour of your good ointments your name is as ointment poured forth: therefore do the virgins love you.
Song 3:6: Who is this that comes out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke: perfumed with myrrh and frankincense: with all powders of the merchant?
Song 5:5: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh: and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh: upon the handles of the lock.
2Co 1:21: 22: Now He which stablishes us with you in Christ: and has anointed us: is God;
Ga 5:22: But the fruit of the Spirit is love: joy: peace: longsuffering: gentleness: goodness: faith:
Php 4:18: But I have all: and abound: I am full: having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you: an odour of a sweet smell: a sacrifice acceptable: wellpleasing to God.
Re 5:8: When he had taken the book: the 4 beasts and 4 and 20 elders fell down before the Lamb: having every one of them harps: and golden vials full of odours: which are the prayers of saints.

 נֹ֛פֶת תִּטֹּ֥פְנָה שִׂפְתֹותַ֖יִךְ כַּלָּ֑ה דְּבַ֤שׁ וְחָלָב֙ תַּ֣חַת לְשֹׁונֵ֔ךְ וְרֵ֥יחַ שַׂלְמֹתַ֖יִךְ כְּרֵ֥יחַ לְבָנֹֽון׃ ס

11 Your lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under your tongue; and the smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.Song of Solomon 4:11
Stats
Counts: 148 characters, 18 words, 110 letters, 37 vowels, 73 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נֹ֛פֶת תִּטֹּ֥פְנָה שִׂפְתֹותַ֖יִךְ כַּלָּ֑ה דְּבַ֤שׁ וְחָלָב֙ תַּ֣חַת לְשֹׁונֵ֔ךְ וְרֵ֥יחַ שַׂלְמֹתַ֖יִךְ כְּרֵ֥יחַ לְבָנֹֽון׃ ס

Lit: as the honeycomb Drip Your lips my spouse Honey and milk are under your tongue and the fragrance of your garments Is like the fragrance of Lebanon

KJV: Thy lips, O my spouse, drop [as] the honeycomb: honey and milk [are] under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments [is] like the smell of Lebanon.
References

"lips"
Song 4:3: Your lips are like a thread of scarlet: and your speech is comely: your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within your locks.
Song 5:13: His cheeks are as a bed of spices: as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies: dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
Song 7:9: The roof of your mouth like the best wine for my beloved: that goes down sweetly: causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.
Ps 71:14: 15: 23: 24: But I will hope continually: and will yet praise you more and more.
Pr 16:24: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb: sweet to the soul: and health to the bones.
Ho 14:2: Take with you words: and turn to the LORD: say to Him: Take away all iniquity: and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.
Heb 13:15: By Him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually: that is: the fruit of our lips giving thanks to His name.

"honey"
Song 5:1: I am come into my garden: my sister: my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat: O friends; drink: yes: drink abundantly: O beloved.
Pr 24:13: 14: My son: eat you honey: because it is good; and the honeycomb: which is sweet to your taste:
Isa 7:15: Butter and honey will he eat: that he may know to refuse the evil: and choose the good.

"the smell"
Song 4:10: How fair is your love: my sister: my spouse! how much better is your love than wine! and the smell of your ointments than all spices!
Ge 27:27: He came near: and kissed Him: and He smelled the smell of His clothing: and blessed Him: and said: See: the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD has blessed:
Ps 45:8: All your garments smell of myrrh: and aloes: and cassia: out of the ivory palaces: whereby they have made you glad.
Ho 14:7: They that dwell under his shadow will return; they will revive as the grain: and grow as the vine: the scent thereof will be as the wine of Lebanon.

H4599 מַעְיָן maʻyân mah-yawn or מַעְיְנוֹ; (Psalm 114:8), or (feminine) מַעְיָנָה; from עַיִן (as a denominative in the sense of a spring); a fountain (also collectively), figuratively, a source (of satisfaction); fountain, spring, well. 		מַעְיָ֥ןma‘-yān a fountain N-ms
H2856חָתֽוּם׃ḥā-ṯūm.   (V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-ms)
H2856 חָתַם châtham khaw-tham a primitive root; to close up; especially to seal; make an end, mark, seal (up), stop. 		חָתֽוּם׃ḥā-ṯūm. sealed V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-ms
12 A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.Song of Solomon 4:12
Stats
Counts: 81 characters, 11 words, 61 letters, 24 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּ֥ן ׀ נָע֖וּל אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּ֑ה גַּ֥ל נָע֖וּל מַעְיָ֥ן חָתֽוּם׃

Lit: A garden enclosed Is my sister my spouse a spring shut up a fountain sealed

KJV: A garden inclosed is my sister, [my] spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.
References

"garden"
Song 6:2: 11: My beloved is gone down into his garden: to the beds of spices: to feed in the gardens: and to gather lilies.
Pr 5:15-18: Drink waters out of your own cistern: and running waters out of your own well.
Isa 58:11: The LORD will guide you continually: and satisfy your soul in drought: and make fat your bones: and you will be like a watered garden: and like a spring of water: whose waters not fail.
Isa 61:10: 11: I will greatly rejoice in the LORD: my soul will be joyful in my God; for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation: He has covered me with the robe of righteousness: as a groom decks Himself with ornaments: and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.
Jer 31:12: Therefore they will come and sing in the height of Zion: and will flow together to the goodness of the LORD: for wheat: and for wine: and for oil: and for the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul will be as a watered garden; and they will not sorrow any more at all.
Ho 6:3: Then will we know: if we follow on to know the LORD: His going forth is prepared as the morning; and He will come to us as the rain: as the latter and former rain to the earth.
1Co 6:13: 19: 20: Meats for the belly: and the belly for meats: but God will destroy both it and them. Now the body is not for fornication: but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.
1Co 7:34: There is difference also between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares'>cares for the things of the Lord: that she may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is married cares'>cares for the things of the world: how she may please her husband.
Re 21:27: There will in no wise enter into it any thing that defiles: neither whatever works abomination: or maketh a lie: but they which are written in the Lamb's book of life.

"sealed"
2Co 1:22: Who has also sealed us: and given the ear of the Spirit in our hearts.
Eph 1:13: In whom you also trusted: after that you heard the word of truth: the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that you believed: you were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise:
Eph 4:30: not grieve the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed to the day of redemption.
Re 7:3: Saying: not Hurt the earth: neither the sea: nor the trees: till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.

13 Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,Song of Solomon 4:13
Stats
Counts: 90 characters, 10 words, 74 letters, 25 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שְׁלָחַ֙יִךְ֙ פַּרְדֵּ֣ס רִמֹּונִ֔ים עִ֖ם פְּרִ֣י מְגָדִ֑ים כְּפָרִ֖ים עִם־נְרָדִֽים׃

Lit: Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates with fruits pleasant Fragrant henna with spikenard

KJV: Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,
References

"are"
Song 6:11: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley: and to see whether the vine flourished: and the pomegranates budded.
Song 7:12: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish: whether the tender grape appear: and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give you my loves.
Song 8:2: I would lead you: and bring you into my mother's house: who would instruct me: I would cause you to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
Ps 92:14: They will still bring forth fruit in old age; they will be fat and flourishing;
Ec 2:5: I made me gardens and orchards: and I planted trees in them of all kind of fruits:
Isa 60:21: Your people also will be all righteous: they will inherit the land for ever: the branch of my planting: the work of my hands: that I may be glorified.
Isa 61:11: For as the earth brings forth her bud: and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
Joh 15:1-3: I am the true vine: and my Father is the husbandman.
Php 1:11: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness: which are by Jesus Christ: to the glory and praise of God.

"pleasant"
Song 6:2: My beloved is gone down into his garden: to the beds of spices: to feed in the gardens: and to gather lilies.

"camphire"
Song 4:14: Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon: with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes: with all the chief spices:
Song 1:14: My beloved is to me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.

"spikenard"
Song 1:12: While the king sitteth at his table: my spikenard sends forth the smell thereof.
Mr 14:3: Being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper: as he sat at meat: there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious; and she brake the box: and poured it on his head.
Joh 12:3: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard: very costly: and anointed the feet of Jesus: and wiped His feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

KJV: Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:

"calamus"

Eze 27:19: Dan also and Javan going to and fro occupied in your fairs: bright iron: cassia: and calamus: were in your market.

"cinnamon"

Re 18:13: Cinnamon: and odours: and ointments: and frankincense: and wine: and oil: and fine flour: and wheat: and beasts: and sheep: and horses: and chariots: and slaves: and souls of men.

"trees"

Song 5:1: I am come into my garden: my sister: my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat: O friends; drink: yes: drink abundantly: O beloved.
Nu 24:6: As the valleys are they spread forth: as gardens by the river's side: as the trees of lign aloes which the LORD has planted: and as cedar trees beside the waters.

"the chief"

Mr 16:1: When the sabbath was past: Mary Magdalene: and Mary the mother of James: and Salome: had bought sweet spices: that they might come and anoint him.

15 A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.Song of Solomon 4:15
Stats
Counts: 73 characters, 11 words, 58 letters, 22 vowels, 36 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מַעְיַ֣ן גַּנִּ֔ים בְּאֵ֖ר מַ֣יִם חַיִּ֑ים וְנֹזְלִ֖ים מִן־לְבָנֹֽון׃

Lit: A fountain of gardens a well of waters living and streams from Lebanon

KJV: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.
References

"fountain"
Song 4:12: A garden inclosed is my sister: my spouse; a spring shut up: a fountain sealed.
Ec 2:6: I made me pools of water: to water therewith the wood that brings forth trees:

"a well"
Ps 36:8: 9: They will be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of your house; and you will make them drink of the river of your pleasures.
Ps 46:4: There is a river: the streams whereof will make glad the city of God: the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.
Jer 2:13: For my people have committed two evils; they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters: and hewed them out cisterns: broken cisterns: that can hold no water.
Jer 17:13: O LORD: the hope of Israel: all that forsake you will be ashamed: and they that depart from me will be written in the earth: because they have forsaken the LORD: the fountain of living waters.
Joh 4:10: 14: Jesus answered and said to her: If you knew the gift of God: and who it is that says to you: Give me to drink; you would have asked of Him: and He would have given you living water.
Joh 7:38: He who believes on me: as the scripture has said: out of his belly will flow rivers of living water.
Re 22:1: He showed me a pure river of water of life: clear as crystal: proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

"streams"
Jer 18:13: 14: Therefore thus says the LORD; Ask you now among the heathen: who has heard such things: the virgin of Israel has done a very horrible thing.

 ע֤וּרִי צָפֹון֙ וּבֹ֣ואִי תֵימָ֔ן הָפִ֥יחִי גַנִּ֖י יִזְּל֣וּ בְשָׂמָ֑יו יָבֹ֤א דֹודִי֙ לְגַנֹּ֔ו וְיֹאכַ֖ל פְּרִ֥י מְגָדָֽיו׃

16 Awake, O north wind; and come, you south; blow upon my garden, that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.Song of Solomon 4:16
Stats
Counts: 167 characters, 24 words, 129 letters, 49 vowels, 80 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: ע֤וּרִי צָפֹון֙ וּבֹ֣ואִי תֵימָ֔ן הָפִ֥יחִי גַנִּ֖י יִזְּל֣וּ בְשָׂמָ֑יו יָבֹ֤א דֹודִי֙ לְגַנֹּ֔ו וְיֹאכַ֖ל פְּרִ֥י מְגָדָֽיו׃

Lit: Awake north wind and come south Blow upon my garden That may flow out Its spices let come my beloved to his garden and eat fruits its pleasant

KJV: Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.
References

"Awake"
Song 1:4: Draw me: we will run after you: the king has brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in you: we will remember your love more than wine: the upright love you.
Ec 1:6: The wind goes toward the south: and turns about to the north; it whirleth about continually: and the wind returns again according to his circuits.
Isa 51:9-11: Awake: awake: put on strength: O arm of the LORD; awake: as in the ancient days: in the generations of old. Are you not it that has cut Rahab: and wounded the dragon?
Isa 64:1: Oh that you would'>would rend the heavens: that you would'>would come down: that the mountains might flow down at your presence:
Eze 37:9: Then said He to me: Prophesy to the wind: prophesy: son of man: and say to the wind: Thus says the Lord GOD; Come from the 4 winds: O breath: and breathe upon these killed: that they may live.
Joh 3:8: The wind blows where it listeth: and you hear the sound thereof: but not canst tell where it comes: and whither it goes: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
Ac 2:1: 2: When the day of Pentecost was fully come: they were all with one accord in one place.
Ac 4:31: When they had prayed: the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost: and they spoke the word of God with boldness.

"the spices"
Song 4:13: 14: Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates: with pleasant fruits; camphire: with spikenard:
Song 7:12: 13: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish: whether the tender grape appear: and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give you my loves.
2Co 9:10-15: Now he who ministers seed to the sower both minister bread for your food: and multiply your seed sown: and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)
Php 1:9-11: This I pray: that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;
Col 1:9-12: For this cause we also: since the day we heard it: not do cease to pray for you: and to desire that you might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
1Th 2:12: 13: That you would walk worthy of God: who has called you to His kingdom and glory.
Heb 13:20: 21: Now the God of peace: that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus: that great shepherd of the sheep: through the blood of the everlasting covenant:
2Pe 3:18: But grow in grace: and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To Him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.

"Let"

Mt 26:10: 12: When Jesus understood it: He said to them: Why trouble you the woman? for she has wrought a good work upon me.
Joh 5:8: Jesus says to Him: Rise: take up your bed: and walk.
Ro 15:16: 28: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles: ministering the gospel of God: that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable: being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.
1Pe 2:5: 9: 10: You also: as lively stones: are built up a spiritual house: an holy priesthood: to offer up spiritual sacrifices: acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

5

בָּ֣אתִי לְגַנִּי֮ אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּה֒ אָרִ֤יתִי מֹורִי֙ עִם־בְּשָׂמִ֔י אָכַ֤לְתִּי יַעְרִי֙ עִם־דִּבְשִׁ֔י שָׁתִ֥יתִי יֵינִ֖י עִם־חֲלָבִ֑י אִכְל֣וּ רֵעִ֔ים שְׁת֥וּ וְשִׁכְר֖וּ דֹּודִֽים׃ ס

1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yes, drink abundantly, O beloved.Song of Solomon 5:1
Stats
Counts: 220 characters, 32 words, 166 letters, 58 vowels, 108 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בָּ֣אתִי לְגַנִּי֮ אֲחֹתִ֣י כַלָּה֒ אָרִ֤יתִי מֹורִי֙ עִם־בְּשָׂמִ֔י אָכַ֤לְתִּי יַעְרִי֙ עִם־דִּבְשִׁ֔י שָׁתִ֥יתִי יֵינִ֖י עִם־חֲלָבִ֑י אִכְל֣וּ רֵעִ֔ים שְׁת֥וּ וְשִׁכְר֖וּ דֹּודִֽים׃ ס

Lit: I have come to my garden my sister my spouse I have gathered my myrrh with my spice I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey I have drunk my wine with my milk Eat friends Drink and yes drink deeply beloved ones

KJV: I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.
References

"come"
Song 4:16: Awake: O north wind; and come: you south; blow upon my garden: that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden: and eat his pleasant fruits.
Song 6:2: 11: My beloved is gone down into his garden: to the beds of spices: to feed in the gardens: and to gather lilies.
Song 8:13: You that dwell in the gardens: the companions listen to your voice: cause me to hear it.
Isa 5:1: Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved has a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:
Isa 51:3: For the LORD will comfort Zion: He will comfort all her waste places; and He will make her wilderness like Eden: and her desert like the garden of the LORD; joy and gladness will be found therein: thanksgiving: and the voice of melody.
Isa 58:11: The LORD will guide you continually: and satisfy your soul in drought: and make fat your bones: and you will be like a watered garden: and like a spring of water: whose waters not fail.
Isa 61:11: For as the earth brings forth her bud: and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
Joh 14:21-23: He who has my commandments: and keeps them: He it is that loves'>loves me: and He that'>He who loves'>loves me will be loved of my Father: and I will love Him: and will manifest myself to Him.

"my sister"
Song 4:9-12: You have ravished my heart: my sister: my spouse; you have ravished my heart with one of your eyes: with one chain of your neck.

Heb 2:12-14: Saying: I will declare your name to my brothers: in the middle of the church will I sing praise to you.

"I have gathered"
Song 4:13: 14: Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates: with pleasant fruits; camphire: with spikenard:
Ps 147:11: The LORD takes pleasure in them that fear Him: in those that hope in His mercy.
Isa 53:11: He will see of the travail of his soul: and will be satisfied: by his knowledge will my righteous servant justify many; for he will bear their iniquities.

"eat"
De 16:13-17: You will observe the feast of tabernacles 7 days: after that you have gathered in your grain and your wine:
De 26:10-14: Now: look: I have brought the firstfruits of the land: which you: O LORD: have given me. And you will set it before the LORD your God: and worship before the LORD your God:
2Ch 31:6-10: concerning the children of Israel and Judah: that dwelt in the cities of Judah: they also brought in the tithe of oxen and sheep: and the tithe of holy things which were consecrated to the LORD their God: and laid them by heaps.
Ps 16:3: But to the saints that are in the earth: and to the excellent: in whom is all my delight.
Isa 23:18: Her merchandise and her hire will be holiness to the LORD: it will not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise will be for them that dwell before the LORD: to eat sufficiently: and for durable clothing.
Isa 55:1: 2: Ho: every one that thirsts: come you to the waters: and he who has no money; come you: buy: and eat; yes: come: buy wine and milk without money and without price.
Isa 62:8: 9: The LORD has sworn by His right hand: and by the arm of His strength: Surely I will no more give your grain to be meat for your enemies; and the sons of the stranger will not drink your wine: for the which you have laboured:
Isa 65:13: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Look: my servants will eat: but you will be hungry: look: my servants will drink: but you will be thirsty: look: my servants will rejoice: but you will be ashamed:
Isa 66:14: When you see this: your heart will rejoice: and your bones will flourish like an herb: and the hand of the LORD will be known toward His servants: and His indignation toward His enemies.
Mt 25:40: The King will answer and say to them: Truly I say to you: Inasmuch as you have done it to one of the least of these my brothers: you have done it to me.
Ac 11:29: Then the disciples: every man according to his ability: determined to send relief to the brothers which dwelt in Judaea:
2Co 9:11-15: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness: which causes through us thanksgiving to God.
Eph 5:18: not be drunk with wine: wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
1Th 3:8: 9: For now we live: if you stand fast in the Lord.

"friends"
Lu 12:4: I say to you my friends: not Be afraid of them that kill the body: and after that have no more that they can do.
Lu 15:6: 7: 9: 10: When he comes home: he calls together his friends and neighbours: saying to them: Rejoice with me; for I have found my sheep which was lost.
Joh 3:29: He who has the bride is the groom: but the friend of the groom: which stands and hears him: rejoices greatly because of the groom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
Joh 15:14: 15: You are my friends: if you do whatever I command you.

"yea, drink abundantly, O beloved"
Zec 9:15-17: The LORD of hosts will defend them; and they will devour: and subdue with sling stones; and they will drink: and make a noise as through wine; and they will be filled like bowls: and as the corners of the altar.
Re 22:17: The Spirit and the bride say: Come. And let Him that hears say: Come. And let Him that is athirst come. And whoever will: let Him take the water of life freely.

 אֲנִ֥י יְשֵׁנָ֖ה וְלִבִּ֣י עֵ֑ר קֹ֣ול ׀ דֹּודִ֣י דֹופֵ֗ק פִּתְחִי־לִ֞י אֲחֹתִ֤י רַעְיָתִי֙ יֹונָתִ֣י תַמָּתִ֔י שֶׁרֹּאשִׁי֙ נִמְלָא־טָ֔ל קְוֻּצֹּותַ֖י רְסִ֥יסֵי לָֽיְלָה׃

2 I sleep, but my heart wakes: it is the voice of my beloved that knocks, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.Song of Solomon 5:2
Stats
Counts: 215 characters, 32 words, 158 letters, 53 vowels, 105 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י יְשֵׁנָ֖ה וְלִבִּ֣י עֵ֑ר קֹ֣ול ׀ דֹּודִ֣י דֹופֵ֗ק פִּתְחִי־לִ֞י אֲחֹתִ֤י רַעְיָתִי֙ יֹונָתִ֣י תַמָּתִ֔י שֶׁרֹּאשִׁי֙ נִמְלָא־טָ֔ל קְוֻּצֹּותַ֖י רְסִ֥יסֵי לָֽיְלָה׃

Lit: I sleep but my heart is awake it is the voice of my beloved He knocks saying Open for me my sister my love My dove my perfect one for my head is covered with dew My locks with the drops of the night

KJV: I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, [saying], Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, [and] my locks with the drops of the night.
References

"sleep"
Song 3:1: By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loves: I sought him: but I found not him.
Song 7:9: The roof of your mouth like the best wine for my beloved: that goes down sweetly: causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.
Da 8:18: Now as he was speaking with me: I was in a deep sleep on my face toward the ground: but he touched me: and set me upright.
Zec 4:1: The angel that talked with me came again: and waked me: as a man that is wakened out of his sleep:
Mt 25:4: 5: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
Mt 26:40: 41: He comes to the disciples: and finds them asleep: and says to Peter: What: could you not watch with me one hour?
Lu 9:32: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake: they saw his glory: and the two men that stood with him.
Eph 5:14: For what reason He says: Awake you that sleep: and arise from the dead: and Christ will give you light.

"the voice"
Song 2:8: 10: The voice of my beloved! look: he comes leaping upon the mountains: skipping upon the hills.
Joh 10:4: When he puts forth his own sheep: he goes before them: and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

"knocketh"
Re 3:20: Look: I stand at the door: and knock: if any man hear my voice: and open the door: I will come in to him: and will sup with him: and he with me.

"Open"
Ps 24:7-10: Lift up your heads: O you gates; and be you lift up: you everlasting doors; and the King of glory will come in.
Ps 81:10: I am the LORD your God: which brought you out of the land of Egypt: open your mouth wide: and I will fill it.
Pr 23:26: My son: give me your heart: and let your eyes observe my ways.

"my dove"
Song 2:14: O my dove: that are in the clefts of the rock: in the secret places of the stairs: let me see your face: let me hear your voice; for sweet is your voice: and your face is comely.
Song 6:9: My dove: my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother: she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her: and blessed her; yes: the queens and the concubines: and they praised her.
Ps 119:1: ALEPH. Blessed are the undefiled in the way: who walk in the law of the LORD.
Re 3:4: You have a few names even in Sardis which not have defiled their garments; and they will walk with me in white: for they are worthy.
Re 14:4: These are they which not were defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb wherever He goes. These were redeemed from among men: being the firstfruits to God and to the Lamb.

"my head"
Song 8:7: Many waters cannot quench love: neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love: it would utterly be contemned.
Ge 29:20: Jacob served 7 years for Rachel; and they seemed to him but a few days: for the love he had to her.
Ge 31:40: 41: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me: and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from my eyes.
Isa 50:6: I gave my back to the smiters: and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair: I not hid my face from shame and spitting.
Isa 52:14: As many were astonied at you; his visage was so marred more than any man: and his form more than the sons of men:
Isa 53:3-5: He is despised and rejected of men; a man of sorrows: and acquainted with grief: and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised: and we esteemed not him.
Mt 8:17: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet: saying: Himself took our infirmities: and bare our sicknesses.
Mt 25:35-45: For I was hungry: and you gave me meat: I was thirsty: and you gave me drink: I was a stranger: and you took me in:
Mr 1:35: In the morning: rising up a great while before day: he went out: and departed into a solitary place: and there prayed.
Lu 6:12: It came to pass in those days: that He went out into a mountain to pray: and continued all night in prayer to God.
Lu 22:44: Being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
2Co 5:14: 15: For the love of Christ constrains us; because we thus judge: that if one died for all: then were all dead:
Ga 2:20: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; not yet I: but Christ lives in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God: who loved me: and gave Himself for me.

3 I have put off my coat; how will I put it on? I have washed my feet; how will I defile them?Song of Solomon 5:3
Stats
Counts: 94 characters, 19 words, 69 letters, 27 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פָּשַׁ֙טְתִּי֙ אֶת־כֻּתָּנְתִּ֔י אֵיכָ֖כָה אֶלְבָּשֶׁ֑נָּה רָחַ֥צְתִּי אֶת־רַגְלַ֖י אֵיכָ֥כָה אֲטַנְּפֵֽם׃

Lit: I have taken off my robe how can I put it on again I have washed my feet how can I defile them

KJV: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

Ro 7:22: 23: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		יָדוֹ֙yā-ḏōw his hand N-fsc | 3ms

H4578וּמֵעַ֖יū-mê-‘ay   (Conj-w | N-mpc | 1cs)
H4578 מֵעֶה mêʻeh may-aw xlit mêʻâh corrected to mêʻeh; from an unused root probably meaning to be soft; used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively); belly, bowels, idiom heart, womb. 		וּמֵעַ֖יū-mê-‘ay and my heart Conj-w | N-mpc | 1cs
H1993הָמ֥וּhā-mū   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H1993 הָמָה hâmâh haw-maw a primitive root (compare הוּם); to make a loud sound (like English hum); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor; clamorous, concourse, cry aloud, be disquieted, loud, mourn, be moved, make a noise, rage, roar, sound, be troubled, make in tumult, tumultuous, be in an uproar. 		הָמ֥וּhā-mū yearned V-Qal-Perf-3cp

4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.Song of Solomon 5:4
Stats
Counts: 85 characters, 18 words, 65 letters, 23 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דֹּודִ֗י שָׁלַ֤ח יָדֹו֙ מִן־הַחֹ֔ר וּמֵעַ֖י הָמ֥וּ עָלָֽיו׃

Lit: My beloved put his hand by the latch of the door and my heart yearned for him

KJV: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.
References

"put"
Song 1:4: Draw me: we will run after you: the king has brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in you: we will remember your love more than wine: the upright love you.
Ps 110:3: Your people will be willing in the day of your power: in the beauties of holiness from the womb of the morning: you have the dew of your youth.
Ac 16:14: A certain woman named Lydia: a seller of purple: of the city of Thyatira: which worshipped God: heard us: whose heart the Lord opened: that she attended to the things which were spoken of Paul.
2Co 8:1: 2: 16: Moreover: brothers: we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;
Php 2:13: For it is God which works in you both to will and to do of His good pleasure.

"my bowels"
Ge 43:30: Joseph made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber: and wept there.
1Ki 3:26: Then spoke the woman whose the living child was to the king: for her bowels yearned upon her son: and she said: O my lord: give her the living child: and in no wise kill it. But the other said: Let it be neither my nor your: but divide it.
Isa 26:8: 9: Yes: in the way of your judgments: O LORD: have we waited for you; the desire of our soul is to your name: and to the remembrance of you.
1Jo 3:16: 17: Hereby perceive we the love of God: because He laid down His life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

5 I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.Song of Solomon 5:5
Stats
Counts: 139 characters, 22 words, 107 letters, 32 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: קַ֥מְתִּֽי אֲנִ֖י לִפְתֹּ֣חַ לְדֹודִ֑י וְיָדַ֣י נָֽטְפוּ־מֹ֗ור וְאֶצְבְּעֹתַי֙ מֹ֣ור עֹבֵ֔ר עַ֖ל כַּפֹּ֥ות הַמַּנְעֽוּל׃

Lit: Arose I to open for my beloved and my hands dripped with myrrh and My fingers with myrrh liquid On the handles of the lock

KJV: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers [with] sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.
References

"rose"

Lu 12:36: you yourselves like to men that wait for their lord: when he will return from the wedding; that when he comes and knocks: they may open to him immediately.
Eph 3:17: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you: being rooted and grounded in love:
Re 3:20: Look: I stand at the door: and knock: if any man hear my voice: and open the door: I will come in to him: and will sup with him: and he with me.

"my hands"
Song 5:13: His cheeks are as a bed of spices: as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies: dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
Song 3:6: Who is this that comes out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke: perfumed with myrrh and frankincense: with all powders of the merchant?
Song 4:13: 14: Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates: with pleasant fruits; camphire: with spikenard:
2Co 7:7: 9-11: not And by his coming only: but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you: when he told us your ear desire: your mourning: your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

H6030עָנָֽנִי׃‘ā-nā-nî.   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms | 1cs)
H6030 עָנָה ʻânâh aw-naw a primitive root; properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce; give account, afflict (by mistake for עָנָה), (cause to, give) answer, bring low (by mistake for עָנָה), cry, hear, Leannoth, lift up, say, idiom scholar, (give a) shout, sing (together by course), speak, testify, utter, (bear) witness. 6 I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spoke: I sought him, but I not could find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.Song of Solomon 5:6
Stats
Rank: #5079 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 185 characters, 31 words, 140 letters, 53 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: פָּתַ֤חְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ לְדֹודִ֔י וְדֹודִ֖י חָמַ֣ק עָבָ֑ר נַפְשִׁי֙ יָֽצְאָ֣ה בְדַבְּרֹ֔ו בִּקַּשְׁתִּ֙יהוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א מְצָאתִ֔יהוּ קְרָאתִ֖יו וְלֹ֥א עָנָֽנִי׃

Lit: Opened I for my beloved but my beloved had turned away and was gone My heart leaped up when he spoke I sought him but not I could find him I called him but no he gave me answer

KJV: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

Is my hand shortened at all: that it cannot redeem? or have I no power to deliver? look: at my rebuke I dry up the sea: I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stinks: because there is no water: and dies for thirst.

7 The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.Song of Solomon 5:7

Translation
Hebrew: מְצָאֻ֧נִי הַשֹּׁמְרִ֛ים הַסֹּבְבִ֥ים בָּעִ֖יר הִכּ֣וּנִי פְצָע֑וּנִי נָשְׂא֤וּ אֶת־רְדִידִי֙ מֵֽעָלַ֔י שֹׁמְרֵ֖י הַחֹמֹֽות׃

Lit: Found me the watchmen who went about the city they struck me they wounded me Took away my veil from me the keepers of the walls

KJV: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

(including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- what Interrog

H2470 חָלָה châlâh khaw-law a primitive root (compare חוּל, חָלָה, חָלַל); properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat; beseech, (be) diseased, (put to) grief, be grieved, (be) grievous, infirmity, intreat, lay to, put to pain, idiom pray, make prayer, be (fall, make) sick, sore, be sorry, make suit (idiom supplication), woman in travail, be (become) weak, be wounded. 		שֶׁחוֹלַ֥תše-ḥō-w-laṯ that sick Pro-r | V-Qal-Prtcpl-fsc

Lit: I charge you daughters of Jerusalem if you find my beloved what you shall tell him that sick of love I am

KJV: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.

H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- upon Prep

12 His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.Song of Solomon 5:12
Stats
Counts: 95 characters, 14 words, 70 letters, 25 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עֵינָ֕יו כְּיֹונִ֖ים עַל־אֲפִ֣יקֵי מָ֑יִם רֹֽחֲצֹות֙ בֶּֽחָלָ֔ב יֹשְׁבֹ֖ות עַל־מִלֵּֽאת׃

Lit: His eyes are] like doves by the rivers of waters Washed with milk And set upon fitly

KJV: His eyes are as [the eyes] of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, [and] fitly set.

"His eyes"

Heb 4:13: Neither is there any creature that not is manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened to the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.Song of Solomon 5:13
Stats
Counts: 109 characters, 13 words, 83 letters, 29 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לְחָיָו֙ כַּעֲרוּגַ֣ת הַבֹּ֔שֶׂם מִגְדְּלֹ֖ות מֶרְקָחִ֑ים שִׂפְתֹותָיו֙ שֹֽׁושַׁנִּ֔ים נֹטְפֹ֖ות מֹ֥ור עֹבֵֽר׃

Lit: His cheeks are like a bed of spices Banks of scented herbs His lips are lilies Dripping myrrh liquid

KJV: His cheeks are as a bed of spices, [as] sweet flowers: his lips [like] lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
References

"cheeks"
Song 1:10: Your cheeks are comely with rows of jewels: your neck with chains of gold.
Isa 50:6: I gave my back to the smiters: and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair: I not hid my face from shame and spitting.

"as a"
Ps 4:6: 7: There be many that say: Who will show us any good? LORD: lift you up the light of your face upon us.
Ps 27:4: one thing have I desired of the LORD: that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life: to look the beauty of the LORD: and to inquire in His temple.
Ps 89:15: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they will walk: O LORD: in the light of your face.
Re 21:23: The city had no need of the sun: neither of the moon: to shine in it: for the glory of God did lighten it: and the Lamb is the light thereof.

"sweet flowers"
Song 3:6: Who is this that comes out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke: perfumed with myrrh and frankincense: with all powders of the merchant?

"his lips"
Song 4:11: Your lips: O my spouse: drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under your tongue; and the smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
Ps 45:2: You are fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into your lips: therefore God has blessed you for ever.
Isa 50:4: The Lord GOD has given me the tongue of the learned: that I should know how to speak a word in season to Him that is weary: He wakes'>wakes morning by morning: He wakes'>wakes my ear to hear as the learned.
Lu 4:22: All bare him witness: and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said: not Is this Joseph's son?

Lit: His hands are rods of gold Set with beryl His body is carved ivory Inlaid with sapphires

KJV: His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly [is as] bright ivory overlaid [with] sapphires.

H730 אֶרֶז ʼerez eh-rez from אָרַז; a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots); cedar (tree). 		כָּאֲרָזִֽים׃kā-’ă-rā-zîm. as the cedars Prep-k, Art | N-mp
15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his face is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.Song of Solomon 5:15
Stats
Counts: 123 characters, 17 words, 96 letters, 37 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שֹׁוקָיו֙ עַמּ֣וּדֵי שֵׁ֔שׁ מְיֻסָּדִ֖ים עַל־אַדְנֵי־פָ֑ז מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ כַּלְּבָנֹ֔ון בָּח֖וּר כָּאֲרָזִֽים׃

Lit: His legs are pillars of marble Set on bases of fine gold His countenance is like Lebanon Excellent as the cedars

KJV: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance [is] as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.
References

"legs"
Re 1:15: His feet like to fine brass: as if they burned in a furnace; and his voice as the sound of many waters.

"sockets"
Ex 26:19: you will make 40 sockets of silver under the 20 boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons: and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.

"his countenance"
Song 2:14: O my dove: that are in the clefts of the rock: in the secret places of the stairs: let me see your face: let me hear your voice; for sweet is your voice: and your face is comely.
Jg 13:6: Then the woman came and told her husband: saying: A man of God came to me: and His face was like the face of an angel of God: very terrible: but I asked Him not">not Him where He was: neither told He me His name:
Mt 17:2: Was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun: and his clothing was white as the light.
Mt 28:3: His face was like lightning: and his clothing white as snow:
Ac 2:28: You have made known to me the ways of life; you will make me full of joy with your face.
Re 1:16: He had in his right hand 7 stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword: and his face was as the sun shines in his strength.

"as Lebanon"
Song 4:11: Your lips: O my spouse: drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under your tongue; and the smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
Ps 92:12: The righteous will flourish like the palm tree: he will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Ho 14:7: They that dwell under his shadow will return; they will revive as the grain: and grow as the vine: the scent thereof will be as the wine of Lebanon.
Zec 9:17: For how great is his goodness: and how great is his beauty! grain will make the young men cheerful: and new wine the maids.
1Ti 3:16: Without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh: justified in the Spirit: seen of angels: preached to the Gentiles: believed on in the world: received up into glory.

Lit: His mouth is most sweet and Yes he is altogether lovely This is my beloved and this is my friend daughters of Jerusalem

KJV: His mouth is most sweet: yea, he [is] altogether lovely. This [is] my beloved, and this [is] my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
References

"mouth"

"most"

Song 2:1: 3: I am the rose of Sharon: and the lily of the valleys.
Ps 45:2: You are fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into your lips: therefore God has blessed you for ever.
Ps 89:6: For who in the heaven can be compared to the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened to the LORD?
Ps 148:13: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for His name alone is excellent; His glory is above the earth and heaven.

1Pe 2:6: 7: For what reason also it is contained in the scripture: Look: I lay in Sion a chief corner stone: elect: precious: and he who believes on him will not be confounded.

"my beloved"

"friend"

1 Whither is your beloved gone, O you fair among women? whither is your beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with you.Song of Solomon 6:1
Stats
Counts: 125 characters, 20 words, 99 letters, 38 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אָ֚נָה הָלַ֣ךְ דֹּודֵ֔ךְ הַיָּפָ֖ה בַּנָּשִׁ֑ים אָ֚נָה פָּנָ֣ה דֹודֵ֔ךְ וּנְבַקְשֶׁ֖נּוּ עִמָּֽךְ׃

Lit: Where has gone your beloved fairest among women where has turned aside your beloved that we may seek him with you

KJV: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
References

"O thou"

Ru 2:12: The LORD recompense your work: and a full reward be given you of the LORD God of Israel: under whose wings you are come to trust.
Isa 2:5: O house of Jacob: come you: and let us walk in the light of the LORD.
Jer 14:8: O the hope of Israel: the saviour thereof in time of trouble: why should you be as a stranger in the land: and as a wayfaring man that turns aside to tarry for a night?

Ac 5:11-14: Great fear came upon all the church: and upon as many as heard these things.

H7799שֽׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃šō-wō-šan-nîm.   (N-cp)
H7799 שׁוּשַׁן shûwshan shoo-shan or שׁוֹשָׁן; or שֹׁשָׁן; and (feminine) שׁוֹשַׁנָּה; from שׂוּשׂ; a lily (from its whiteness), as aflower of architectural ornament; also a (straight) trumpet (from the tubular shape); lily, Shoshannim. 		שֽׁוֹשַׁנִּֽים׃šō-wō-šan-nîm. lilies N-cp
2 My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.Song of Solomon 6:2
Stats
Counts: 109 characters, 19 words, 84 letters, 32 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דֹּודִי֙ יָרַ֣ד לְגַנֹּ֔ו לַעֲרוּגֹ֖ות הַבֹּ֑שֶׂם לִרְעֹות֙ בַּגַּנִּ֔ים וְלִלְקֹ֖ט שֹֽׁושַׁנִּֽים׃

Lit: My beloved has gone to his garden to the beds of spices to feed his flock in the gardens and to gather lilies

KJV: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
References

"gone"
Song 6:11: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley: and to see whether the vine flourished: and the pomegranates budded.
Song 4:12-16: A garden inclosed is my sister: my spouse; a spring shut up: a fountain sealed.
Song 5:1: I am come into my garden: my sister: my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat: O friends; drink: yes: drink abundantly: O beloved.
Isa 58:11: The LORD will guide you continually: and satisfy your soul in drought: and make fat your bones: and you will be like a watered garden: and like a spring of water: whose waters not fail.
Isa 61:11: For as the earth brings forth her bud: and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
Mt 18:20: For where two or 3 are gathered together in my name: there am I in the middle of them.
Mt 28:20: Teaching them to observe all things whatever I have commanded you: and: indeed: I am with you alway: even to the end of the world. Amen.

"the beds"
Song 5:13: His cheeks are as a bed of spices: as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies: dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

"feed"
Song 1:7: 8: Tell me: O you whom my soul loves: where you feed: where you make your flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turns aside by the flocks of your companions?
Isa 40:11: He will feed his flock like a shepherd: he will gather the lambs with his arm: and carry them in his bosom: and will gently lead those that are with young.
Eze 34:23: I will set up one shepherd over them: and he will feed them: even my servant David; he will feed them: and he will be their shepherd.
Zep 3:17: The LORD your God in the middle of you is mighty; He will save: He will rejoice over you with joy; He will rest in His love: He will joy over you with singing.
Joh 4:34: 35: Jesus says to them: My meat is to do the will of Him that sent me: and to finish His work.
Re 7:17: For the Lamb which is in the middle of the throne will feed them: and will lead them to living fountains of waters: and God will wipe away all tears from their eyes.

"and to"
Song 2:2: As the lily among thorns: so is my love among the daughters.
Isa 57:1: The righteous perishes: and no man lays it to heart: and merciful men are taken away: none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
Joh 14:3: If I go and prepare a place for you: I will come again: and receive you to myself; that where I am: there you may be also.
Joh 17:24: Father: I will that they also: whom you have given me: be with me where I am; that they may look my glory: which you have given me: for you lovedst me before the foundation of the world.
Php 1:21-23: For to me to live is Christ: and to die is gain.
1Th 4:13: 14: But I not would have you to be ignorant: brothers: concerning them which are asleep: that you not sorrow: even as others which have no hope.

4 You are beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.Song of Solomon 6:4
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: יָפָ֨ה אַ֤תְּ רַעְיָתִי֙ כְּתִרְצָ֔ה נָאוָ֖ה כִּירוּשָׁלִָ֑ם אֲיֻמָּ֖ה כַּנִּדְגָּלֹֽות׃

Lit: as beautiful you are my love as Tirzah Lovely as Jerusalem Awesome as an army with banners

KJV: Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as [an army] with banners.

"beautiful"

Song 4:7: You are all fair: my love; there is no spot in you.

"as Tirzah"

"comely"

5 Turn away your eyes from me, for they have overcome me: your hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.Song of Solomon 6:5

Translation

Lit: Turn away your eyes from me for they have overcome me Your hair is like a flock of goats Going down from Gilead

KJV: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

"away"

"overcome me"

H7353 רָחֵל râchêl raw-kale from an unused root meaning to journey; a ewe (the females being the predominant element of a flock) (as a good traveller); ewe, sheep. 		הָֽרְחֵלִ֔יםhā-rə-ḥê-lîm, of sheep Art | N-fp
H5927שֶׁעָל֖וּše-‘ā-lū   (Pro-r | V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H5927 עָלָה ʻâlâh aw-law a primitive root; to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative; arise (up), (cause to) ascend up, at once, break (the day) (up), bring (up), (cause to) burn, carry up, cast up, phrase shew, climb (up), (cause to, make to) come (up), cut off, dawn, depart, exalt, excel, fall, fetch up, get up, (make to) go (away, up); grow (over) increase, lay, leap, levy, lift (self) up, light, (make) up, idiom mention, mount up, offer, make to pay, phrase perfect, prefer, put (on), raise, recover, restore, (make to) rise (up), scale, set (up), shoot forth (up), (begin to) spring (up), stir up, take away (up), work. 		שֶׁעָל֖וּše-‘ā-lū which have come up Pro-r | V-Qal-Perf-3cp

H4480 מִן min min or מִנִּי; or מִנֵּי; (constructive plural) (Isaiah 30:11); for מֵן; properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses; above, after, among, at, because of, by (reason of), from (among), in, idiom neither, idiom nor, (out) of, over, since, idiom then, through, idiom whether, with., 		מִן־min- from Prep

H3605שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙šek-kul-lām   (Pro-r | N-msc | 3mp)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙šek-kul-lām every one Pro-r | N-msc | 3mp
H8382מַתְאִימ֔וֹתmaṯ-’î-mō-wṯ,   (V-Hifil-Prtcpl-fp)
H8382 תָּאַם tâʼam taw-am a primitive root; to be complete; but used only as denominative from תָּאוֹם,; to be (causatively, make) twinned, i.e. (figuratively) duplicate or (architectural) jointed; coupled (together), bear twins. 		מַתְאִימ֔וֹתmaṯ-’î-mō-wṯ, bears twins V-Hifil-Prtcpl-fp
H7909וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖הwə-šak-ku-lāh   (Conj-w | Adj-fs)

H369אֵ֥ין’ên   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. Compare אַיִן. 		אֵ֥ין’ên none is Adv
Hבָּהֶֽם׃bā-hem.   (Prep | 3mp)
 		בָּהֶֽם׃bā-hem. among them Prep | 3mp
6 Your teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one bears twins, and there is not one barren among them.Song of Solomon 6:6
Stats
Counts: 138 characters, 23 words, 107 letters, 40 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׁנַּ֙יִךְ֙ כְּעֵ֣דֶר הָֽרְחֵלִ֔ים שֶׁעָל֖וּ מִן־הָרַחְצָ֑ה שֶׁכֻּלָּם֙ מַתְאִימֹ֔ות וְשַׁכֻּלָ֖ה אֵ֥ין בָּהֶֽם׃

Lit: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep which have come up from the washing every one bears twins and barren none is among them

KJV: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and [there is] not one barren among them.
References

"Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them."
Song 4:2: Your teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn: which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins: and none is barren among them.
Mt 21:19: When he saw a fig tree in the way: he came to it: and not foundhing thereon: but leaves only: and said to it: Let no fruit grow on you henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away.
Mt 25:30: Cast you the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

 כְּפֶ֤לַח הָרִמֹּון֙ רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃

7 As a piece of a pomegranate are your temples within your locks.Song of Solomon 6:7
Stats
Rank: #6120 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 61 characters, 12 words, 49 letters, 19 vowels, 30 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּפֶ֤לַח הָרִמֹּון֙ רַקָּתֵ֔ךְ מִבַּ֖עַד לְצַמָּתֵֽךְ׃

Lit: Like a piece of pomegranate Are your temples inside behind your veil

KJV: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.
References

"As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks."
Song 4:3: Your lips are like a thread of scarlet: and your speech is comely: your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within your locks.

8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.Song of Solomon 6:8
Stats
Rank: #7651 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 82 characters, 9 words, 69 letters, 28 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׁשִּׁ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ מְּלָכֹ֔ות וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים פִּֽילַגְשִׁ֑ים וַעֲלָמֹ֖ות אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃

Lit: Sixty are the queens and eighty concubines and virgins without number

KJV: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
References

"There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number."
1Ki 11:1: But king Solomon loved many strange women: together with the daughter of Pharaoh: women of the Moabites: Ammonites: Edomites: Zidonians: and Hittites;
2Ch 11:21: Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took 18 wives: and threescore concubines; and begot 28 sons: and threescore daughters.)
Ps 45:14: She will be brought to the king in clothing of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her will be brought to you.
Re 7:9: After this I beheld: and: indeed: a great multitude: which no man could number: of all nations: and kindreds: and people: and tongues: stood before the throne: and before the Lamb: clothed with white robes: and palms in their hands;

H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הִיא֙hî is Pro-3fs
